jobText: TXT/50533621.txt	§Lifeguards§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguards§§Advertiser: §Belgravia Health & Leisure Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§New Zealand, Franklin Pool & Leisure - Pukekohe 2120§ §Jubilee Pool, Pukekohe Hill 2120§Whiteside Pool, Waiuku 2123§ §Great career paths and development with an entrepreneurial organisation§Free facility access §Enjoy a great work / life balance with mornings, evenings and weekend shifts  §Multiple Part time positions available § §This is a great opportunity for qualified lifeguards who value water safety, §love working with people, who want to keep the community safe in our facilities§.§ § §The Company§ §Belgravia Leisure§ is part of the Belgravia Health and Leisure Group (BHLG) and is the fastest growing leisure organisation in Australia. Our core areas of business and facilities stewardship include health clubs, wellness and spa, golf, aquatic and sporting venues in 150 locations across Australia and New Zealand. § §We are in an exciting period of growth, and look to continue to diversify and deliver results while being a strong community citizen.  With an annual turnover in excess of $180m, the group are looking for the best and brightest to assist with taking the organisation into the future.§ §The Role§ §We are currently looking for enthusiastic, reliable and friendly §lifeguards§ to join the team, over the §summer period§ of December 2020 to March/April 2021. Our lifeguards will be responsible for the Day to Day Pool Operations within our facility and ensure that all areas both in and surrounding our pools is a safe and enjoyable environment for all patrons.§ §You will have a passion for safety around the water. You should be energetic, dynamic, outgoing and fun. You will need outstanding communication skills and a commitment to customer service excellence to ensure our patrons safely enjoy their visit every time.§ §Successful applicants will demonstrate the ability to communicate and interact effectively with students that have a diverse range of ages, abilities, cultures and needs. §Must be a current PLPC and First Aid holder and be available to work weekends and be available on call if required.§ §Skills & Attributes:§Excellent verbal communication skills§An understanding of OHS and public safety applications within your facility§Ability to work mornings, evenings and weekends§Ability to work effectively both independently and as a strong and valuable part of the team§Current First Aid (Level 2) & Current CPR Certificate§National Police Check§Current Pool Lifeguard Certificate§Previous experience and success in a comparable role is not essential but highly regarded§Current Pool Operations Certificate is not essential but highly regarded§ § If you are a passionate person who realises the tremendous opportunity that this role offers and want to utilise your skills and passion in an aquatic and leisure environment, §we want to hear from you!§ §We are not asking for a resume from you. Simply complete the application process by clicking the Apply Now button and we’ll be in touch.§ §Pukekohe 2120 §§§§

jobText: TXT/50541864.txt	§Central Region Relationship Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Central Region Relationship Manager§§Advertiser: §Gymnastics New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§MATERNITY COVER§ §Gymnastics New Zealand is the recognised National Sports Organisation responsible for the development, promotion and governance of Rhythmic and Artistic Gymnastics, Aerobics, Trampoline, Tumbling and Gym for All.   We are a forward thinking, dynamic organisation who value hard work and fun in equal measures.§ §We are seeking to fill a Relationship Manager position in the Central Region for a 12-month period.  The role would ideally suit individuals with knowledge and experience in sport development and/or sport management and who are already established in the sport sector.§ §The core purpose of the Relationship Manager role is:§ § §To provide sport development and capability support for the gymnastic sport clubs in the Central Region.§ §To identify opportunities and implement effective strategies to increase participation in gymnastic sports, and establish and maintain diverse and sustainable relationships.§ §Some important attributes to fulfil this role would be:§ § §The ability to effectively manage relationships with a customer-centric mindset.§ §A strong communicator.§ §Have strong research and writing capability.§ §Good project management skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.§ §A positive demeanour and a solution based attitude to challenging situations.§ §Based in Wellington, this role covers the central region (Hawkes Bay/Poverty Bay, Whanganui/Manawatu and Nelson/Blenheim). Periodic travel is required however, much of the engagement with clubs and partners is done remotely.§ §This role provides exciting opportunities to develop and lead on projects both within the region and at National level and will suit someone who is self-motivated, proactive and passionate about sport.§ §Please see the attached Job Description for further details regarding this role.§ §If you are interested, we would love to hear from you. Please forward a full CV and covering letter to Belinda Randall §belinda.randall@gymnasticsnz.com§ § §Job Description can be found here - https://www.gymnasticsnz.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Central-RM-Job-vacancy.pdf § §Applications close on Monday 5th October 2020 at 9.00am. Interviews will take place week beginning 12th October.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50555570.txt	§Playball Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Playball Coach§§Advertiser: §Playball Northland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Whangarei§§Salary§§$20 - $24.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Job purpose§We’re searching for dynamic and enthusiastic coaches to deliver high energy, fast paced classes to preschoolers and primary school aged children at sporting venues and early childcare centres/schools across Whangarei. This role is for 10-15hours per week with room to gain more hours for the right person. You’ll be working in a tight knit team with opportunities to learn and grow within the business. §Tasks and duties§Your tasks and duties will include:§ § §Coaching a number of 45 minute fast paced sports classes for children (hours vary but most classes take place between the hours of 9am and 4pm Mon - Fri and 9am - 12pm Saturdays). § §Equipment set up and pack down. § §Cleaning of equipment where necessary. § §Clear and friendly communication with children, teachers and parents. § §Travel between locations. § §Contributing ideas for lesson plans. § §Skills, experience, availability and resources§To apply for this job you must have:§ § §Exceptional teamwork and communication skills. § §A full, clean drivers license. You will be required to use your own vehicle to travel between sessions (you will be compensated for this).§ §A clean police record (you will need to consent to the Police Vetting process). § §Be organised and able to manage your time well. § §A commitment and passion for developing and empowering children to be the best they can be. § §Experience in physical education or sports coaching is preferred but not mandatory. § §Be physically fit.§ §All training, uniforms and equipment will be provided. §Benefits§We are a small team with a great work ethic and we have lots of fun! Hours of work are flexible to work around your study with extra opportunities to earn at the weekend with birthday parties. All training is provided and because it is a small business there is a lot to learn in various aspects of the business. §We coach with the school terms so have the school holidays off (although extra work opportunities with holiday programmes are possible).§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§Do you have experience working with children?§§§

jobText: TXT/50561102.txt	§Outdoor Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outdoor Instructor§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §Join YMCA for an amazing New Zealand camp experience?§ §We are now in pursuit of experienced outdoor instructors to join our enthusiastic team at Camp Adair (Hunua Ranges).§ § § §YMCA Outdoors provides fun filled experiences for school and community groups, providing a wide range of activities such as archery, climbing, kayaking, high ropes, mountain biking, sailing and orienteering.§ § § §What will you be doing?§ §This is a casual position where hours/shifts will vary week to week, which may include weekdays, weekends and overnight stays.  Some of the key duties will be:§ § §Instruct outdoor educational programmes to groups largely aged 8-14, including setting up and packing down equipment.§ §Instruct school holiday programmes (this will include staying overnight during the programme).§ §School Holiday Camp programmes- including activity instruction, free time, mealtimes and sleepover support.§ §Be responsible for Health and Safety of campers.§ §Assist with camp tasks including cleaning, maintenance and catering§ § § §What experience/skills do you need?§ §To be a successful Outdoor Instructor for YMCA you need to be passionate about the outdoors, love working with children and all ages, be able to excite others and share your love of the outdoors, as well as the following attributes:§ § §Relevant certificates, qualifications and technical skills, including; Outdoor First Aid, High Ropes, Skills Active Quals, NZOIA§ §Experience working with children and/or camps i.e. can include job placements, work experience, volunteer work, etc.§ §Knowledge of water safety and experience with water based activities, being a strong confident swimmer is an advantage.§ §Confidence in talking to groups§ §Ability to give instructions and encourage participation.§ §Ability to think on your feet, be creative and have strong communication skills.§ §Quick learner with the ability to teach others§ §Physically active & able to be on your feet all day, often exposed to the outdoor elements (if you don’t like getting wet or muddy this isn’t for you!)§ §Flexibility to work shifts including some weekends and overnights§ §Hardworking & reliable –with your own transport§ §Work as part of a team but also on your own§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ §Apprenticeship Opportunities§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 800 employees across Auckland, Hamilton and Tauranga? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, and Respect and Responsibility§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. NOW!§  §We are looking for an experienced Multi-Site Fitness Manager to work across Lagoon Pool and Leisure Centre (Panmure) and Ellerslie Recreation Centre on a full time.  The role is to manage and develop two fitness departments to achieve programme area advancement, financial success and operational excellence.  The role will require department staff management, financial management, business planning, marketing, risk management, programme and service development and effective evaluation and reporting§  § §  §What will you be doing?§ § §Create and maintain a motivated and positive fitness team§ §Monitor the daily performance of the fitness teams acknowledging success and good performance and provide coaching when performance falls outside the desired standards§ §Involved in end to end recruitment and people management§ §Prepare and monitor the fitness roster and sign off timesheets§ §Lead and manage the group exercise timetable to offer an attractive service proposition§ §Grow group exercise participation numbers§ §Generate the fitness budget and complete associated reports within the specified annual timeframes that includes realistic projections, sound financial modelling and improved financial results § §Create a fun and friendly environment within the Fitness Club that is welcoming and comfortable to all members, new and old, and encourages a sense of belonging and support§ §Lead the development and implementation of fitness retention strategies§ §Ensure all membership retention KPIs are met or exceeded§ §Ensure all customer enquiries responded to within 24 hours and complaints are minimised and handled politely§ §Lead, develop and manage all areas of the fitness department. § §Implement and run training programmes for group fitness and other YMCA programmes.§ § §  §What experience/skills do you need? § § §Register of Exercise Professionals (REPs) registered to ‘Exercise Consultant Level 2’ or above§ §Budgeting and business planning experience – has prepared an annual business plan and budget, achieved or exceeded targets, and has a financial understanding of the business§ §Sales, marketing and management experience – has worked with sales, is confident in planning a marketing campaign and has experience of leading a sales and fitness team§ §Staff management experience§ §Knowledge of the fitness industry§ § §  §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ §Apprenticeship Scheme§ § §  § §  §ABOUT THE YMCA§  §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 800 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§  §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§  §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§  § §  §SAFEGUARDING§  §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§  §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§  §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§  § §  §TO APPLY§  §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §Wil-Riaan.E@ymcaauckland.org.nz§  § §  §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50588001.txt	§Coaching Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coaching Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Athletics New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the business§The purpose of Athletics New Zealand (Athletics NZ) is to encourage, enhance and promote all aspects of athletics in New Zealand and each week thousands of people take part in Athletics NZ’s initiatives. §Athletics NZ has a rich heritage of Olympic and Commonwealth Games success. Athletics NZ has spawned some of New Zealand’s sporting icons – Dame Yvette Corlett, Sir Peter Snell, Sir John Walker and recently, Tom Walsh, Dame Valerie Adams, Nick Willis and Eliza McCartney - all of whom were developed by grassroots domestic coaches who work with our network of 170+ clubs nationwide. §About the role§The Coaching Coordinator will be the operational lead for all Athletics NZ’s coach development initiatives, from parents as first coaches through to coaches working with performance athletes. §You will be supporting and developing existing coaches, as well as assisting to identify and educate new coaches.§Reporting to the Coach Development Lead, the Coaching Coordinator will be responsible for engaging with our coaching community - ensuring that the systematic needs of our participants are met and that the value of coaching to our athletics community and society is recognised.§The Coach Coordinator will work in close partnership with the Athletics NZ team, active and potential coaches, Sport NZ, Regional Athletics Centres and Regional Sports Trusts to ensure the effective delivery of various coach development projects. §This work is pivotal in the continued growth of the sport of Athletics in NZ, ensuring our coaches are contributing to the growth of our sport.   §Skills and experience§To be the ideal candidate for this role you will have some coach development experience, or relevant experience within the sport of athletics, as well as the following attributes:§Strong presentation, interpersonal and communication skills.§A passion for coaching and coach development.§Effective organisation and time management skills§Energy and commitment, as well as being self-motivated, positive and creative.§A passion for sport, and empathy in a volunteer environment.§Reporting to the Coach Development Lead, the role is listed as Auckland based, but could alternatively be based in Hamilton or Tauranga.§To apply for this position please email a CV and cover letter to §susan@athletics.org.nz§ no later than midday on Sunday October 11th, 2020.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50600002.txt	§Centre Manager - Nelson Netball§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Centre Manager - Nelson Netball§§Advertiser: §Intepeople Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Centre Manager - Nelson Netball §      §        §          §Outstanding leadership opportunity§          §Combine your passion for sports and community§          §Work with a motivated and committed team§        §        §Nelson Netball Centre (NNC) have an exciting opportunity for a passionate, driven and motivated individual to join their team in working together to achieve their shared vision of quality netball experiences. §Netball is the largest sporting code, by participation in the region and we are looking for someone who has strong organisation and communication skills to work alongside the Netball community including clubs, schools, sponsors, volunteers and other stakeholders. §Ideally, you will bring to the role successful leadership and management experience within the sporting/community arena and a strong understanding of how sports organisations work within the community.  §Together with the Board you’ll play a key role in the strategic planning of NNC. You’ll take responsibility for operational and financial management, marketing and sponsorship, as well as reporting and communication.  §A natural organiser with a collaborative, down to earth approach you’ll have the ability to get alongside people and inspire them to be the best that they can be.  With an upbeat, forward thinking approach and plenty of enthusiasm you’re willing to get involved wherever it’s needed.§        §This is a rare and exciting chance to apply your skills and play a key role in the future of Netball in the Nelson area.§Applications close Monday 2nd November 2020, for a start date in early 2021.§View the §job description§. §For further enquiries please call Gary Cox on 021 548 273.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §Outstanding leadership opportunity§ §Combine your passion for sports and community§ §Work with a motivated and committed team§Nelson Netball Centre (NNC) have an exciting opportunity for a passionate, driven and motivated individual to join their team in working together to achieve their shared vision of quality netball experiences. §Netball is the largest sporting code, by participation in the region and we are looking for someone who has strong organisation and communication skills to work alongside the Netball community including clubs, schools, sponsors, volunteers and other stakeholders. §Ideally, you will bring to the role successful leadership and management experience within the sporting/community arena and a strong understanding of how sports organisations work within the community.  §Together with the Board you’ll play a key role in the strategic planning of NNC. You’ll take responsibility for operational and financial management, marketing and sponsorship, as well as reporting and communication.  §A natural organiser with a collaborative, down to earth approach you’ll have the ability to get alongside people and inspire them to be the best that they can be.  With an upbeat, forward thinking approach and plenty of enthusiasm you’re willing to get involved wherever it’s needed.§This is a rare and exciting chance to apply your skills and play a key role in the future of Netball in the Nelson area.§Applications close Monday 2nd November 2020, for a start date in early 2021.§View the §job description§. §For further enquiries please call Gary Cox on 021 548 273.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Notice Period§Residency Status§Desired Region§Mobile Number§§§

jobText: TXT/50602069.txt	§Community Basketball Manager - Auckland Basketball Services Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Community Basketball Manager - Auckland Basketball Services Ltd§§Advertiser: §Global Elite Sports§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Competitive base salary plus car§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Community Basketball Manager - Auckland Basketball Services Ltd §      §        §ROLE SUMMARY:§        §Reporting into the General Manager of ABSL, the primary focus of this position is the sustainable creation and development of ABSL owned and operated Clubs across all stakeholder regions and the engagement and participation of independent clubs into ABSL programmes, events, and leagues.§        §This will include the development of a Community Growth Strategy and overseeing the implementation of local and regional Club strategies with the aim of driving engagement and growing participation in quality basketball for all local communities.§        §You will work closely and develop strong working relationships with other members of the ABSL management team and a wide range of community stakeholders including regional sport organisations, schools, community organisations & groups, volunteers and local ABSL and independent basketball clubs.§        § §        §DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:§        §          §A fundamental understanding and / or experience working in Community Sport.§          §Outstanding relationship management skills and experience with diverse stakeholders.§          §Proven background with successfully managing internal and external stakeholder relationships that have been critical to the achievement of targets and objectives.§          §Experience developing and delivering both strategic and operational plans.§          §A team player who can work in a collaborative and supportive manner that ensures superior team performance.§          §Excellent project management, administrative and commercial competency§          §Willingness to take ownership and be accountable for results§          §Tertiary education in sports management and / or business is desirable§        §        § §        §ABOUT AUCKLAND BASKETBALL:§        §Auckland Basketball Services Limited (ABSL) is the shared services organisation for three of NZ’s largest basketball Associations - Basketball Auckland, Counties Manukau Basketball and Waitakere West Auckland Basketball. It was set up to deliver basketball services across the region and to provide a strong, united voice for basketball communities across the region.§        §On behalf of its shareholder associations, ABSL aspires to be the leading regional basketball organisation in New Zealand delivering outstanding basketball experiences for athletes, officials, coaches and managers and inspiring a vibrant and inclusive basketball community across greater Auckland.§        §Basketball is one of the fastest growing sports in New Zealand and is on the verge of becoming the largest sport in New Zealand secondary schools. Auckland is at the epicenter of that growth in basketball. As part of a wider transformation programme, we are investing further in the development of Community Basketball to service the unsatisfied demand and to grow participation in this great sport.§        § §        §This is an exciting opportunity to support the community / grassroots game and increase overall participation and consumers of Basketball across greater Auckland. §        § §        §APPLICATIONS CLOSE – Monday 5th October 2020§      §      §To apply, please send your resume and cover letter to: §richard@globalelitesports.com§ §    §    §  §§§ROLE SUMMARY:§ §Reporting into the General Manager of ABSL, the primary focus of this position is the sustainable creation and development of ABSL owned and operated Clubs across all stakeholder regions and the engagement and participation of independent clubs into ABSL programmes, events, and leagues.§ §This will include the development of a Community Growth Strategy and overseeing the implementation of local and regional Club strategies with the aim of driving engagement and growing participation in quality basketball for all local communities.§ §You will work closely and develop strong working relationships with other members of the ABSL management team and a wide range of community stakeholders including regional sport organisations, schools, community organisations & groups, volunteers and local ABSL and independent basketball clubs.§ § § §DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:§ § §A fundamental understanding and / or experience working in Community Sport.§ §Outstanding relationship management skills and experience with diverse stakeholders.§ §Proven background with successfully managing internal and external stakeholder relationships that have been critical to the achievement of targets and objectives.§ §Experience developing and delivering both strategic and operational plans.§ §A team player who can work in a collaborative and supportive manner that ensures superior team performance.§ §Excellent project management, administrative and commercial competency§ §Willingness to take ownership and be accountable for results§ §Tertiary education in sports management and / or business is desirable§ § § §ABOUT AUCKLAND BASKETBALL:§ §Auckland Basketball Services Limited (ABSL) is the shared services organisation for three of NZ’s largest basketball Associations - Basketball Auckland, Counties Manukau Basketball and Waitakere West Auckland Basketball. It was set up to deliver basketball services across the region and to provide a strong, united voice for basketball communities across the region.§ §On behalf of its shareholder associations, ABSL aspires to be the leading regional basketball organisation in New Zealand delivering outstanding basketball experiences for athletes, officials, coaches and managers and inspiring a vibrant and inclusive basketball community across greater Auckland.§ §Basketball is one of the fastest growing sports in New Zealand and is on the verge of becoming the largest sport in New Zealand secondary schools. Auckland is at the epicenter of that growth in basketball. As part of a wider transformation programme, we are investing further in the development of Community Basketball to service the unsatisfied demand and to grow participation in this great sport.§ § § §This is an exciting opportunity to support the community / grassroots game and increase overall participation and consumers of Basketball across greater Auckland. § § § §APPLICATIONS CLOSE – Monday 5th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

This is a permanent position with average weekly hours of 34.5 hours per week.§ § The role of the Senior Pool Lifeguard is to proactively supervise the pool environment and monitor the well-being and safety of pool visitors through compliance with pool policies. This includes assisting the Pool Duty Manager with the day-to-day operation of the facility as required and leading a team of casual Lifeguards over the busy summer period. It also involves delivering a consistently high quality of customer service to ensure that the facility’s reputation and image are established, maintained and enhanced.§ § Ultimately we are about delivering on our vision of Piritahi Tairāwhiti - making our people proud.§ § To be successful in this role you will be a highly motivated team player who is well organised and committed to providing excellent customer service and quality results.§ § A current First Aid Certificate is essential for the role. Successful applicants also need hold a current Pool Lifeguard Practicing Certificate or achieve the qualification prior to employment. Training and assessment options are available at the Olympic Pool Complex.§ § If this sounds like you, please click and apply now! jobText: TXT/50608369.txt	§Aquatics Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Manager§§Advertiser: §Central Otago District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Did you know that each piece of Central Otago stone fruit secretly holds the taste of the sunshine inside it? Or that the Clyde Dam has enough concrete in it to build a footpath from New Zealand to New York? And guess where the longest running cinema in the entire world is located?.... You got it, Central Otago! Central Otago, and the entire Otago region, are home to some of New Zealand’s (if not the world’s) best cycling, mountain biking and recreational walking and running trails.§ § § §Central Otago is a phenomenal place to live and work and the Central Otago District Council is seeking an experienced Aquatics Manager to join our team.§ § § §The primary responsibilities of this role is to be responsible for effectively managing all aspects of both the Alexandra, Cromwell and Ranfurly Pools as well as providing advice and assistance to other community pools in the district. In this position you will be required to manage all operations of the aquatic facility, continue to build a successful learn to swim programme and increase participation numbers for the pools. You will be required to provide leadership and direction to all staff to ensure these areas are maintained at the highest possible standard and to ensure the highest level of customer service to our customers.§ § § §As the successful applicant you will have a strong background in leadership, project and customer service management, this is a hands-on, varied position that is responsible for the day-to-day running of the facilities including all aspects of operation. § § § §Key responsibilities of the position include:§ § §Financial Management (budgeting, financial reporting and cash control)§ §Provide a strategic overview and direction of the aquatic facilities§ §Engage with the local community to increase participation at the facilities§ §Manage, train, develop and evaluate all staff in aquatic operations§ §Develop and implement programme evaluation systems for aquatic programmes§ §Pool plant operations§ §Hiring, rostering and training staff§ §Comply with legislative and organisational requirements relating to: Health and Safety and Pool Operation§ §Manage pool capital development programs§ § § §Full details of the job description can be obtained from Council’s website § www.codc.govt.nz§ under Vacancies.§ § § §All applications should include a cover letter, CV and address the key selection criteria, make sure your cover letter is specific about your experience and what you are looking for now.§ § § §Applications should be addressed to Louise Fleck, Executive Manager – People and Culture, Central Otago District Council, PO Box 122, Alexandra 9340 or sent via email to Louise at §people@codc.govt.nz§. Applications close Wednesday, 14 October 2020 at 12noon.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Formed in 1910, New Zealand Rugby League (NZRL) is the governing body for the sport of rugby league in New Zealand.§ §NZRL is divided into seven zones that service the grassroots needs of the game. These zones compete in the National Premiership/Championship, as well as women’s, youth and schools’ competitions. Through its “More Than A Game” philosophy, NZRL aspires to transform lives and community wellbeing through Rugby League - Kia whakatōmuri te haere whakamua.§ § § §This is a rare opportunity for a dynamic sports administrator to §lead the delivery of the LeagueSmart injury prevention programme§ for New Zealand Rugby League!§ § § §To apply, please send your resume and cover letter to: §richard@globalelitesports.com§ §APPLICATIONS CLOSE – Friday 9th October, 2020 §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

Specifically an amazing Spin Class Instructor.§  §​​We have over 40 classes per week on our timetable, so there is potential for extra classes to be picked up in the future and also the option to cover casually. PLUS you get a free gym membership!§  §As an ALLFIT Group Fitness Instructor, you will be a part of a team striving to inspire our members throughout their fitness journey; building rapport, engaging and educating them on the latest fitness trends, encouraging them, and offering support in their training.§  §Our group fitness classes range from HIIT, Spin, to Strength and Conditioning.  You will need to experienced in taking spin/group cycle classes and be available to be rostered to take a class on 1-2 Saturday mornings per month.§  §What are we looking for?§ § §A passion for people and their health and wellbeing;§ §Previous Group Fitness Instructor experience;§ §Outstanding customer service and people skills;§ §The ability to work in a team environment;§ §A minimum of REPS registration to Exercise Consultant Level III or the ability to gain registration;§ §The ability to instruct functional group HIIT classes would be highly regarded, but not essential.§ §What's next?§If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you – please apply NOW for the opportunity to meet with a member of the team to discuss the details.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you completed a qualification in fitness?§§§

jobText: TXT/50624216.txt	§Boxing Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Boxing Instructor§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §YMCA is looking for an experienced Boxing Instructors to join the team at Massey Leisure Centre=.  These roles will be to provide quality instruction to our participants to ensure maximum learning, enjoyment and development within Group Fitness or Recreation.§ § § §What will you be doing?§ § §Delivering scheduled classes§ §Prescribe and demonstrate exercise§ §Generate a vibrant and inclusive environment§ §Proactively engaging with class participants§ §Ensuring healthy and safe practices are followed§ §Helping to on-board individuals that have shown interest in our facility§ § § §What experience/skills do you need? § § §Boxing instructing experience§ §Is REPs Registered (or able to train to be)§ §Holds a Fitness qualification (or currently studying)§ §Current First Aid Certificate helpful§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 165 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §antionette.a@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§§§

jobText: TXT/50628884.txt	§Aquatics Education Instructor - Part Time §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Education Instructor - Part Time §§Advertiser: §Horowhenua District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Aquatics Education Instructor – Permanent Part-Time§Are you passionate about teaching and enjoy working in an active and fun team? We are currently recruiting for a permanent Aquatics Education Instructor to help support and cover the constantly growing Streamline Swim School in the Horowhenua.§Swimming is a crucial lifesaving skill and we pride ourselves on delivering the highest standard of swimming and water safety lessons. We offer lessons from 6 month old babies to adults and everyone in between. This includes working with local schools and sports clubs to help support the growth of swimming and water sports in the district.§We are currently looking for one permanent part-time Aquatics Education Instructor with a minimum of 10 hours per week to join the team at Streamline Swim School to help support with covering classes and supporting the schools learn to swim classes. Reporting to the Aquatics Education Coordinator, you will be working on an ad hoc basis to deliver water safety and swimming lessons to a variety of different ages and abilities.§Experience in the industry is always a plus, but as long as you have passion and the desire to learn, full training and qualifications will be provided on the job. Sessions normally run from 3pm – 6.30pm Monday to Friday and from 8.30am – 1pm Saturday.§Sound like the position for you or just want to know more? jobText: TXT/50636514.txt	§Coaches Wanted - Competitive & Recreational Gymnastics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coaches Wanted - Competitive & Recreational Gymnastics§§Advertiser: §Mt. Want to spend more time with your family? Here’s an opportunity to find the perfect work life balance!§  §Mt Tauhara Gymnastics Club is located in the beautiful resort town of Taupō, on the shores of New Zealand’s largest lake and just a stone’s throw from the world famous Tongariro National Park. §  §We enjoy a relaxed lifestyle in a sports-oriented community with amazing opportunities for skiing, mountain biking, hiking and water sports on our doorstep.§  §The club has a supportive committee dedicated to ensuring a friendly, safe environment for athletes and coaches.§  §Unicorn Coach Wanted! (Senior WAG Coach)§ §Please come and be our unicorn! We have an exciting opportunity for someone to step in and be the unicorn our girls need!§ § §We are seeking an experienced WAG Coach to lead and grow our WAG competitive programme. We have a strong community of up and coming gymnasts who will thrive on your ability to develop athletes to reach their full potential.§ §The ideal candidate will be passionate about the sport, willing to build on our existing programme and able to coach all levels of gymnasts. § §You will also be mentoring our younger coaches as they gain experience and complete higher qualifications.§ §Experience coaching at a senior level and a minimum of Gymnastics NZ Senior qualification (or international equivalent) is required. §  §This is a permanent position that could be part or full time depending on your availability and ability to coach all WAG levels.§  §Recreational Coach§ §We are seeking a recreational gymnastics coach with the ability to oversee the delivery of our Gym For All programme. § §The successful candidate will ideally have experience coaching recreational classes at all levels and have the ability to coach our popular Ninja Gym classes (although this is not essential). § §You will provide guidance and support to our junior recreational coaches and assist them in developing their coaching skills.§ §This role takes responsibility for creating a fun and safe environment for our young gymnasts, growing their confidence through skill development and growing our recreational programme by delivering an exceptional experience for families.§ §The ideal candidate will have a foundation coaching qualification, however on-the-job training towards this qualification can be provided to a person with existing coaching skills who is the right fit for our team. §  §Hours of work will be 15-20 per week to start with, but this may increase as the programme grows.§  §For further information on joining our club in the heart of the North Island, please contact §Heather Hilton §at§ coach@mttauharagymnastics.co.nz. §  §To apply, please send your CV and a cover letter.§§§§

The successful applicant must be flexible, committed and a good team player. Good administrative skills and an active interest in sport would be an advantage.§  §Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§  §For more information about ACG Strathallan, please visit: https://strathallan.acgedu.com/§  §How to apply:§  §https://hr.acgedu.com/positions/9277§  § §  §Equal opportunity employer §  §ACG Schools is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  We will consider applications from all suitably qualified individuals regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, marital status, disability, family responsibilities or natural origin.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50648707.txt	§Secondary Schools Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Secondary Schools Manager§§Advertiser: §Aktive§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§About the organisation:§ §Aktive is a charitable trust with the purpose of providing leadership to the Auckland region that encourages, enables and inspires Aucklanders to lead more active lives through play, active recreation and sport.§ §Working with others, Aktive is responsible for setting regional strategy, investment, devising sport systems and initiatives, advocacy, and shared services. We enjoy collaborative relationships with our partners, who are focused on building capabilities to help targeted communities to be more active. This approach is underpinned by our community sport strategy: §The Auckland Approach to Community Sport§ – a vision for co-creating a world-class sport system in Auckland through the application of a targeted approach.§ §Aktive is committed to safeguarding children and young people, staff and organisations. In accordance with our Child Protection Policy and Procedures, all positions are subject to safer recruitment and screening processes, including police vetting checks.§ §About the role: § §Reporting to the Portfolio Manager, the successful candidate will be working as part of a skilled §Korikori§  team focused on helping youth (rangatahi) participate in play, physical education, active recreation and (intra and inter) sport through the school setting. You will do this by influencing and supporting school and sport leaders, management and coaches by obtaining and sharing insights and data, combined with sector intelligence and first-hand experiences.§ §Working closely with the Regional Sport Directors and College Sport Auckland, a key focus of the role will be overseeing the provision of advice, resources, professional development, and localised personnel support available to intermediate and secondary schools and kura to ensure quality physical activity experiences are being designed, delivered and accessed, particularly for those who are missing out.§ §You will be:§ § §action orientated with a ‘can do attitude’§ §a thoughtful and experienced sport director with a proven capability in influencing changes in attitudes, behaviours and processes§ §passionate for and have a strong understanding of youth sport, active recreation and play, and what quality experiences look like§ §skilled in partnering, planning, networking and facilitation as evidenced through impact on the ground.§ §This role will involve working at various locations throughout Auckland and require the ability to be flexible with work hours, which will include some evenings and/or weekends.§ §Benefits: § §A competitive salary package, plus company vehicle, are provided, and the organisation is committed to providing excellent professional development opportunities.§ §How to apply:§ §If you require the detailed role description, please email §careers@aktive.org.nz§ and we would be happy to email you an copy.§ §Applications close Sunday, 25 October 2020 at 5 PM§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

jobText: TXT/50648958.txt	§Good Sports Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Good Sports Advisor§§Advertiser: §Aktive§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the organisation:§ §Aktive, a charitable trust, has been set up to achieve the vision of Auckland being the world's most active city. We are committed to helping people and communities across Auckland to live more active lives.§ §As a key strategic partner for both Sport New Zealand and Auckland Council, Aktive invests in organisations and initiatives that will increase and sustain participation and strengthen all parts of the sporting and recreational system. This is underpinned by our community sport strategy: §The Auckland Approach to Community Sport§ – a vision for co-creating a world-class sport system in Auckland.§ §About the role: § §Reporting to the Portfolio Manager (Good Sports), you will be providing leadership in regard to Good Sports® and support towards the development and implementation of other opportunities for key adult influencers of young people 5-18 years – including coaches, parents, teachers, sports leaders and administrators part of §The Auckland Approach to Community Sport. §This involves working closely with Regional Sports Trusts (RSTs), CLM Community Sport, National Sport Organisations (NSOs), Regional Sport Organisations (RSOs), College Sport, clubs, schools, commercial entities and other providers of sport and recreation opportunities. § §Good Sports is an award winning initiative that is utilised to support the sector to align with Sport New Zealand’s Balance is Better philosophies in Tāmaki Makaurau.§ §You will lead the development, implementation and evolution of Good Sports to improve the quality of resources and information for the Auckland sector. This includes training and development, providing organisation support, developing resources and sharing knowledge. It also comprises regional planning, thought leadership and establishing approaches to better engage with targeted groups.§ §You will be:§ § § Experienced at influencing changes in attitudes, behaviours and processes§ §Knowledgeable about the current youth sport landscape and related research§ §Experienced in a leadership role within people capability development§ §Skilled in programme development and management, including analysis and evaluation§ §Practiced in engaging different communities within different environments§ §A strong communicator, facilitator, networker and relationship builder§ §Customer-centric with a ‘can do attitude.’§ §This role will involve working at various locations throughout Tāmaki Makaurau and require the ability to be flexible with work hours, which will include some evenings and/or weekends.§ §Benefits: § §A competitive salary package, plus a company vehicle, is provided and the organisation is committed to providing excellent professional development opportunities.§ §How to apply:§ §Email §careers@aktive.org.nz§ for a full job description for this exciting role.§ §Applications close Sunday 25 October 2020 at 5 PM§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

jobText: TXT/50678403.txt	§Sports Minded People wanted for Sales & Marketing Opportunity!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sports Minded People wanted for Sales & Marketing Opportunity!§§Advertiser: §Solstice Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§On offer is the opportunity for passionate sports minded individuals to start and contribute to the growth of the face to face sales and customer service acquisitions teams. We are looking for 4 competitive & ambitious personalities who know how to deliver the best customer experience possible, to be a part of the growth with our current campaigns and clients. § § §A rare entry level opportunity to develop and learn new key skills in sales and marketing with the chance to pursue a career path in this challenging & rewarding role!§ § §Solstice Group are the trusted face of New Zealand’s nationally recognised brand & organisations across the market. Perfect for people who love face to face interaction, you’ll be responsible for bringing in new customers and performing great customer service. Sporting personalities always have the ideal mentality and skills to be good at what we do.§ § § §Solstice Group Offers:§ § §Structured Training - Full industry and product training provided§ §Personalised daily coaching by industry experts and mentors § §Team Environment - Electric atmosphere, no clock-watching here! § §Travel opportunities to work across NZ nationwide! § §Choice of up to 6 days work available every week§ §Quality transferrable skills in marketing, brand awareness and sales§ §Career progression and self-development opportunities§ §Are you looking for your next big career move? Perfect!§ §We are looking for:§ § §Extremely coachable individuals who love to learn § §Temperature setters! The life of the party with an outgoing & vibrant personality§ §A competitive streak that drives you to improve, develop and win§ §Great communication skills§ §Pervious customer service experience §  § §The reason we look for these qualities when recruiting to find the next talent coming through our business, is that people with sporting experience usually excel in our industry and already have the foundations on which to build the skillset required to be successful!§ §Immediate §starts are available for the right person/people!§ § § §With a lot of great applicants looking for work right now, numbers are through the roof! § §Be sure to apply §TODAY§ to be contacted by a member of the Talent Search Team within 48 hours of applying. § § § §Check out our socials;§Instagram - @solstice_group §Website – §http://nz.solsticegroup.co§\§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§

jobTitle: Pregnancy Fitness Trainer Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679604.txt	§Pregnancy Fitness Trainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pregnancy Fitness Trainer§§Advertiser: §Kate Ivey Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§$40 - $59.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§We are looking for a qualified fitness trainer located anywhere, with experience and qualifications in workouts for pregnant women, to join our wonderful team!§ §DediKate by Kate Ivey Fitness is the online health and fitness community for busy New Zealand Women. DediKate consists of a number of different weekly workouts that can be done anytime and anywhere, nutrition advice and expertise, recipes, regular challenges, a super supportive online community and more!§ §This is an amazing opportunity for the right person to join our community of over 1500 women and growing. You must have values that align with ours. Everything we do is about a long term, sustainable approach to health and fitness. Our core focus is helping women to lead a healthy and balanced lifestyle they can maintain.§ §The successful applicant will lead two weekly online workouts designed for pregnant women. They will have experience and qualifications in prenatal exercise. They will show evidence that they also lead a healthy balanced lifestyle, and have a passion for helping others. They will be confident, friendly and fun, with a positive attitude.§ §This is a work from home position and you can be located anywhere, but must have a strong internet connection and a suitable space to lead the workouts from.§ §Please email in your cover letter, CV and a short video about yourself to Kate on §kate@kateiveyfitness.co.nz§ by Sunday 1st November.§ §If you have any questions about this position, please don’t hesitate to get in touch.§ §Check us out at:§www.kateiveyfitness.co.nz§www.facebook.com/kateiveyfitness§www.instagram.com/kateiveyfitness§§§§

jobTitle: Event Director Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679675.txt	§Event Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Event Director§§Advertiser: §Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§We are seeking an Event Director who is committed to excellence in events.§ §The Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge is looking for someone with the passion and commitment to take this event to the next level. Ideally, this person will be Taupo based and have in depth knowledge and experience of the Events Industry and be passionate about continuing the legacy of this iconic event well into the future. Strong leadership, financial, marketing, and organisational skills are essential. § §This is a contracted role commencing 2021 and reporting to the Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge Trust. § §BACKGROUND - OUR ‘WHY’ § §We’re the Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge, one of NZ’s biggest annual sport participation events.§ §Our mission is to create an innovative, financially viable, sought after cycling event that celebrates biking in all its forms and creates memorable experiences for all participants.§ §Held on the last Saturday in November each year, Lake Taupo Cycle Challenge is managed and delivered by a small team of proud locals who feel honoured and privileged to be involved with such a large-scale, world-class event. We’ve developed over 44 years, and have grown from grass roots to one of New Zealand’s most iconic sporting occasions. We are genuinely proud of what the event has become and are looking for a passionate committed person to take this event to the next level for future generations.§ §Internationally renowned, we generate the largest economic impact of any event in the Taupo region. Owned by a Charitable Trust, and governed by a Rotary-appointed Board, all surpluses are injected back into the community, benefitting a number of worthy groups and organisations.§ §Our aim is that our valued event participants see Cycle Challenge as being innovative, aspirational, inclusive, challenging yet achievable, and quite simply, the best event of its kind.§ §We are looking for an Event Director to: § § §Develop, lead and drive the strategic direction of the event§ §Manage relationships with key stakeholders and event partners§ §Lead and manage the event team providing day to day support§ §Prepare, manage and report on the event budget§ §Ensure 100 percent compliance with regulatory requirements and best practice§ §Oversee event safety and operational plans§ §Develop, lead and drive the marketing strategy§ §Hold overall responsibility for event delivery§ §Act as the event spokesperson§ §Present monthly reports and financial statements to the LTCC Trust§ §Bring creative flair, innovation and the determination to deliver outstanding results for the event§ §Desirable key competencies and experience:§ § §5 years plus of event experience and event management§ §Understanding of sponsorship principles, contracts and delivering benefits§ §Experience in building an event from concept to delivery§ §Commercial experience and astute financial acumen including budgeting§ §Strong leadership and management experience§ §Proven experience in building relationships across a range of stakeholders and partners§ §A strong understanding of current marketing strategies and practices is essential § §Experience in strategic planning and reporting§ §Proven time management and attention to detail§ §Strong verbal and written communication skills§ §A passion for cycling§ §Applications should be emailed by 30 October 2020 to the Trust Chair, Kay Brake: §kay@cyclechallenge.com§§§§

jobTitle: Aquatics Director Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680156.txt	§Aquatics Director§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Director§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§We’re looking for an inspirational leader to manage and develop our popular public aquatics facilities.§ §As Hamilton Pools Aquatics Director, you’ll head a dedicated lead team including an Operations Manager, Assets and Contract Manager and Customer Experience Manager who help to run Waterworld, our large, international-standard swimming and gym facility, and Gallagher Aquatic Centre, our smaller venue.§ §This is an exciting time to be joining our pools operation, as we’ve recently completed a significant $10.7M upgrade of Waterworld.§ §It’s important you’ve managed an aquatics operation of this size before. We are in a period of exciting change, so you’ll need to come with new ideas and the experience to deliver on them while bringing your people along with you.§ §You won’t be flying solo, though – you’ll be part of Hamilton City Council’s community services team with backing from senior management to make improvements and implement change.§ §You’ll also be leading a team of experienced aquatics sector professionals who know their business and customers well and have a strong sense of ownership towards the facilities they manage for the people of Hamilton.§ §We are passionate about providing affordable, accessible sports and leisure opportunities that support the health and wellbeing of our community.§ §Your ability to produce and provide strategic plans and growth for our aquatics operation is crucial to success in this position, as is identifying risks and opportunities.§ §Hamilton Pools welcomes 400,000 people every year and we need to ensure our processes and plant are compliant and meet regulatory requirements and our customers have a safe, enjoyable experience every time. You’ll be able to demonstrate a solid commitment to health and safety and risk management.§ §We are also looking for a change maker with strong commercial nous. You’ll be expected to develop the business through your relationships and networks in the leisure and sports industry. You will develop and lead the Hamilton Pools business plan.§ §While you’re building on new opportunities, you’ll also be keenly aware of what’s happening back at home base. You’ll have solid processes and procedures in place to keep things humming and you’ll be a great people manager, energetic, reliable and comfortable handling a varied and busy workload.§ §You will need to be able to work across the Council’s business support units, developing strong links with our Communication and Engagement, People, Safety and Wellness and Finance Units.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to join an organisation committed to building a stronger economy and a more attractive city for all Hamiltonians.§ §For a copy of the position description, please click § HERE§.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. This role is covered by the Children’s Act 2014, which means short-listed candidates will be required to undergo all safety checking requirements under the Act before commencing employment, as well as during employment. In addition, short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, credit check, pre-employment medical and drug assessments and Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50680321.txt	§Lifeguards- Wellington Regional Aquatic Centre (Kilbirnie Pool)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguards- Wellington Regional Aquatic Centre (Kilbirnie Pool)§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Looking to start your sport and recreation career?§If you looking for an opportunity to work in a fun environment where people come first, and want the chance to make a positive difference to people's lives then we would like to hear from you!§The Parks, Sport and Recreation team lead the provision of a wide range of services, facilities and outcomes across the city. As part of the Recreation Facilities team you will make a significant contribution to those outcomes as a lifeguard. The Wellington Regional Aquatic Centre is the regions premier aquatic venue and plays host to a busy schedule of different water sports and activities.§We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic person to join our Facility Operations team. As a member of this team you will provided with a stimulating working environment as well as all necessary training and ongoing development opportunities. You will have an outgoing personality with excellent verbal communication skills that enables you to build trust with a wide section of the local community both with individuals and groups and an interest in sport and recreation. Relevant experience and qualifications are desirable, but if you don't have these and can demonstrate you have the energy and personality we are looking for then you should still apply.§Essential: You need to be able to confidently swim 200 meters within 4 minutes and 30 seconds and be prepared to under go 8.5 days of training for the rest of October 2020.§Qualifications you will gain are:§First aid certificate level 2§Pool Life Saving Practicing Certificate§NZQA Qualifications through Skills Active§If this sounds like you then apply now, all applications must be submitted online. For more information or if you have any questions, please contact Reece Fraser on §Reece.Fraser@wcc.govt.nz§. Applications close on §Sunday 18 October 2020§ Applicants must be prepared to undergo pre-employment health and drug screening if short-listed.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Lifeguard Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680365.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §Community Leisure Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Splash into Summer with a new job as a “Lifeguard”. CLM is looking for a team of fit and reliable employees to work in our local South Wairarapa pools (Greytown, Featherston and Martinborough).§ §The successful applicants will be preforming duties and tasks including supervising patrons, providing first aid to assist those when required, water rescue, water testing, basic repairs, customer service, and facility cleaning.§ §This position offers the opportunity to gain NZQA unit standards in water safety and first aid Certificate.§ §A full uniform will be provided, working a roster over seven days, training begins in November (3-4 days) and employment starts late November and through to Mid-March 2021. Ideally you will have some experience however; full training will be provided for people with the right attitude who are confident swimming 200 meters, in less than eight minutes.§ §If you feel this role may be for you and enjoy working with the public then please apply today.§ §The shifts will be between 9am -7:45pm on a roster over 7 Days§ §You may be working at any of the 3 pools so must be able to get yourself there.§ §You must be capable of passing a pre-employment police check and available to work weekends and over the Christmas/New Year period.§ §If this sounds like you please send your CV with covering letter to Bridget Cairns on §BRC@clmnz.co.nz§ or via Seek application process.§ §Application period closes Thursday 5th November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50681774.txt	§Sailing Leaders - Casual§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sailing Leaders - Casual§§Advertiser: §Sir Peter Blake MERC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Sailing Leaders - Casual§ § § §Sir Peter Blake MERC §Sir Peter Blake Marine Education & Recreation Centre (MERC) is a not for profit charity based at Long Bay, Auckland. We offer marine-based environmental education and outdoor recreational experiences primarily for young New Zealanders. For more information about MERC, please see our website www.merc.org.nz§ §The Opportunities §MERC is looking to grow our existing pool of outdoor sailing leaders. Therefore, we are looking for vibrant and dynamic individuals with sailing qualifications to join our wider team of outdoor leaders.  You will identify with MERCs mission statement of providing life-changing marine environmental education and outdoor experiences and this will be evident in how you work. As these are casual opportunities, hours of work are rostered and may include some weekends.  §You will be part of an enthusiastic team, delivering quality outdoor experiences to a variety of schools, corporate groups, and other not-for-profit organisations. In this role, you will support them in fostering MERCs mission statement through the means of:§ § §Delivering various land and water-based outdoor activities (with a focus on sailing);§ §Providing guidance on marine education to raise awareness of environmental sustainability and protection;§ §Helping to keep our facility clean and tidy;§ §Maintaining and checking gear §  § §You§ §The ideal candidates will have completed industry relevant qualifications in sailing and have experience leading groups in this context.  Working experience in similar organisations or with similar craft to what we use at MERC (MAC 370) is desirable. You will have a genuine interest in continuing to grow and evolve in the outdoor recreation space. You will be good at listening and can take guidance from other colleagues over daily tasks.§ §In addition to this, you will be able to work independently in a controlled setting consistently collecting information about the environment you are working in and be able to use this to make rational and sensible decisions. The ideal candidates will strive to bring life to the vision and mission of MERC and will be willing to get stuck in! § §You will be knowledgeable of Te Ao Maori, Principles of the Treaty of Waitangi and how they can be applied to a working context or at a minimum have an awareness of them and openness to learn.§ § §Requirements§ § §Industry recognised qualifications and proficiency in sailing;§ §Working towards or completed a Maritime VHF Operator course;§ §First Aid qualified§ §Passionate about the marine environment and the outdoors;§ §Ethical standards in-line with MERCs values and mission;§ §Legally able to work in New Zealand;§ §Clean police check§ § §Advantageous (Desirable)§ § §Previous experience leading different groups in sailing trips§ §Experience operating MAC 370 craft§ §Previous experience working with young children§ §Knowledge of the outdoors including the marine environment § § § §If this sounds like you, please include a cover letter and CV in your application through Seek or to §office@merc.org.nz§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§
