jobText: TXT/50690060.txt	§Director of Football§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Director of Football§§Advertiser: §Papamoa FC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Papamoa FC - Expression of Interest - Director of Football§ §Papamoa FC are one of the largest clubs in the WaiBop region with our playing numbers increasing year on year. We are a club which operates juniors through to seniors. We expect to be the largest club by participants in the region within the next few years.§ §We are the reigning WaiBop Premiership Champions having achived back to back titles in 2019 and 2020. We aspire to entering NRFL and are well on our way to achieving this.§ §We have great fields, what we believe to be the best fields in the city and in what we believe to be the best location in the country.§ §As such we are seeking a suitably Qualified Director of Football to lead the club forward in our continuing quest for improvement.§ §The applicant must hold a minimum of an OFC/NZF C Licence with a view to achieving a B Licence in 2021 or hold an international B Licence equivalent. § §We are happy to accept applications from someone who can provide a B Licence or better to support their application.§ §The applicant must also hold or intend to be fully NZF J3 qualified by March 2021.§ §We are open to how this looks in terms of delivery and may consider someone delivering in a lesser or greater capacity.§ §This is a contract/contractor role for the 2021 season. At the time of applying, candidates are invited to indicate their expected income expectations and preference of delivery capacity.§ §The DOF at a minimum shall have overall responsibility for§ § §Developing and delivering training programmes at all levels for all members throughout the club with a key focus on our Junior and Youth framework. This is Including but not limited to annual reaccreditation of NZF programmes.§ §Delivering Coach development workshops and upskilling all coaches within Papamoa FC.§ §Managing and administering the Clubs Trials management programme.§ §Delivering PFC annual tournaments (boys and girls).§ §Delivering Holiday Programmes.§ §Delivering in schools.§ § § §Please send your CV and covering letter by email to president@papamoafootballclub.co.nz§ § § §Applications close on Sunday the 11th of October however should a suitable applicant apply we will be in contact sooner.§ § § §All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobTitle: Group Fitness Instructor Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50691235.txt	§Group Fitness Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness Instructor§§Advertiser: §True Womans Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§Who are we? §True Womans Fitness is the largest women's only gym in NZ  currently located in Manukau with around 20 group fitness staff. §We are looking at expansion to §Hamilton§ starting with offering a women's only Group Fitness timetable including Les Mills to the women of the Waikato. §It will begin with a 4 week trial from a school hall in Puketaha (5 minutes from Rototuna) with the potential to grow the timetable and become permanent if class numbers grow and show viability. §Who do we need ?§We are looking for female Les Mills instructors who are qualified or training to become qualified in BodyCombat, BodyBalance or Grit. §Alternatively experienced group fitness instructors who can deliver a 30 minute HIIT class with no equipment (ie: similar to a Grit class), Yoga, pilates or similar. §To begin with, we are wanting to hold classes at 6am, 9.15am and 6.30pm  between Monday and Friday. §Your responsibilities ?§Will be to put on a kick ass class to a group of women, be high energy, caring, fun and enthusiastic. §You will also need to engage with clients as the arrive at and leave class and potentially to lock up and unlock the building. §What will you get ? §Between $30-40 per class depending on class length and experience. §You will also get to be part of launching the True brand in a new city and be part of the awesome team at True. §Check us out on instagram at @truewomanfitness §Send CV outlining experience and availability to §andrea@truewoman.co.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695692.txt	§Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season§§Advertiser: §Hurunui District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §North Canterbury§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§The Hurunui District Council are looking for competent, 'pool smart' people able to work a variety of hours on a fixed-term part-time basis including weekends, over the 2020/2021 summer season.§ §The Amberley pool is open from mid-November to mid-March for school use and public sessions. Training and preparation of the pool will start in early November.§ §Ideally, you will have lifeguard experience but full training will be provided. Duties of lifeguards include ensuring guest safety, enforcing rules, responding to emergencies and providing medical care as trained. All staff perform cleaning duties to maintain a safe and clean facility.§ §You will need to have a strong commitment to health and safety standards and to ensure high standards of customer service.§ §If selected for an interview for a lifeguard position, you will be required to complete a swim competency test. This involves:§ § §Swim 200m freestyle in under 6 minutes (in togs, goggles are permitted)§ §Swim 50m breaststroke (in lifeguard uniform)§ §Swim 25m sidestroke (in lifeguard uniform)§ §Retrieve and object from the bottom of the pool (min 1.2 m - max 3m in lifeguard uniform)§ §Tread water for 5 minutes (in lifeguard uniform)§ §If you have a passion for swimming, a strong customer service ethic, relate well to adults and children, reliable, and have a positive, cheerful, outgoing personality, and are a team player then we would love to hear from you.§ §Preference may be given to applicants who are already qualified and those who are available for the full season.§ §If you are a swim teacher this could also be incorporated into the role. We will also take expressions of interest for swim teachers.§ §For additional information and position description email charlie.hutt@hurunui.govt.nz or phone 027 808 9113.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: hdcjobs.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5237456. § §Applications close 25 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696402.txt	§Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach§§Advertiser: §King's High School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§We want to appoint an effective head coach and/or co-coach to lead our 1st XV Rugby team at King’s High School for the 2021 season.§  §Commencing January 2021§  §King's High School - First XV Coach/Co-Coach§  §Purpose§ §  §To develop our 1st XV players and coaching team to perform highly.  To be responsible for planning and delivering our 1st XV programme.§  §Background§  §King’s High School rugby is recognised as being at the forefront of secondary school rugby in Otago and Southland; demonstrating outstanding participation, coaching, facilities, results and pathways to professional careers.§  §Since the school’s inception in 1936, King’s has produced 13 All Blacks, 15 Internationals, 10 Super Rugby players and over 70 First Class Representatives.  Rugby continues to be the most popular sport at King’s with over 200 players participating across 8 teams each week.  Rugby adds much to the character and competitiveness of the boys and school.§  §Recent 1st XV success has included 3 finals and 1 championship in the Otago Premier Schools competition, 3 New Zealand Barbarian Schools representatives, and 9 Highlanders Schools representatives. The 2019 Otago U16 team also contained 16 players from King’s.§  §We are now looking for our next coach to add to the quality of our premier rugby team and proud record of rugby excellence at King’s.§ §Personal Qualities/Skills§  §Applicants should have:§ § §A love of rugby§ §Proven ability to motivate aspiring rugby players and to coach them well§ §Experience in dynamic and successful leadership and management in or out of sport§ §Proven ability to set tactics and lead strategic direction successfully§ §Understanding of contemporary rugby performance § §Commitment to the highest sporting and personal standards in coach and player conduct, and to upholding our positive 1st XV culture and King’s Lions’ Sport values § §Commitment to foster wider King’s High School development through sport§ §Exceptional communication and relationship skills§ §Experience in reviewing sporting performance and use of analysis software§ §Proven record of being well organised and coping while under pressure§ §A sense of humour and other desirable, and sometimes necessary, personal attributes§ §The appointed person will report to the King’s Director of Rugby. This position will be reviewed on an annual basis. §  §Applications are to be made online through Seek, and should include; a cover letter outlining:§ § §Why you are well suited to this position§ §What you would do with the position, if appointed§ §Curriculum Vitae to summarise your rugby experience§ §Contact information for three referees§ §For more information about King’s High School, please see our website  https://www.kingshigh.school.nz§  §Contact our Director of Rugby, Glenn Dickson, if you have any questions regarding this role or the selection process: Directorofsport@kingshigh.school.nz§  §(Note: This position may potentially be combined with a Teaching post at King’s High School in 2021.   If also seeking a teaching job please provide your teaching Curriculum Vitae as well).§  §Deadline for applications: 5pm 30 October 2020§  §We look forward to hearing from you.§  §Glenn Dickson§Director of Sport§Director of Rugby§King’s High School§§§§

As well as the ability to accommodate members restrictions with exercises and offer suitable regressions.§ §Ensure the studio is kept clean and tidy.§ §A willingness to work flexible hours.§ §Skills & Experience:§ § §Experience in delivering group fitness sessions.§ §Excellent verbal skills- in particular, the ability to command a large group efficiently and effectively.§ §Willingness to work flexible hours, in particular, early mornings and evenings.§ §Ability to motivate members.§ §Enthusiastic and supportive attitude towards members.§ §Ability to develop and nurture strong relationships with members.§ §Self-motivated and goal orientated.§ §Passionate, enthusiastic and genuinely motivated to improve the lives of others.§ §Excellent attention to detail, especially when it comes to movement patterns.§ §Culture & Benefits:§ § §Opportunity for growth as we grow our business.§ §Ongoing mentoring opportunities.§ §Commitment to work-life balance § §Training provided on F45 product and technology.§ §Small, motivated team to work in.§ §Great support network within the F45 Group.§ §Free F45 Marshland Membership to attend classes.§ §Qualifications/Requirements:§ § §Certificate 4 in Fitness (Diploma or degree desirable).§ §Current First Aid and CPR.§ §A willingness to continue learning and upskilling.§  § §If you want to join our team please send your CV to jduff@f45training.co.nz§ §While we appreciate everyone who takes the time to apply, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50709627.txt	§Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead §      §        §          §Help make a positive contribution to your community at our popular pool facilities§          §Vital role within a supportive and safety-focussed team§          §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed-term opportunity until 2 April 2021§        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Our pool and leisure facilities are more popular than ever, and as Lead Lifeguard for Birkenhead Pool and Leisure Centre you will play a key part in ensuring that all customers not only have a fantastic experience but a safe one. Your main responsibilities will include:§        § §        §          §Providing guidance on and supporting the delivery of aquatics based programmes;§          §General lifeguarding duties to ensures customers are safe and looked after; and§          §Supporting the Team Leader with day to day operations at the Centre.§        §        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §It goes without saying that you’ll have a passion for aquatics, and you’ll enjoy sharing your knowledge and experience with customers and colleagues to improve water safety. You will be an excellent communicator, and committed to delivering exceptional aquatic programmes and providing a high level of customer satisfaction.  Joining an energetic and passionate team, you’ll be a keen team player with a flexible approach, and be able to take initiative to help drive a positive safety culture.§        § §        §You’ll need to hold a current First Aid Certificate as well as a Pool Lifeguard Practising Certificate. As the centre operates 7 days a week, reliability and commitment to working early, late and weekend shifts are crucial.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §You’ll have access to a range of fantastic Auckland Council benefits, including an annual zoo pass and a range of partnership discounts. And as you will be a Leisure Centre employee, you will enjoy free use of the facilities. To find out more about Birkenhead Pool and Leisure, please visit our §website§.§        § §        §We have a full-time permanent and a secondment/fixed-term opportunity until 2 April 2021. jobText: TXT/50745994.txt	§Drug Free Sport NZ Educator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Drug Free Sport NZ Educator§§Advertiser: §Drug Free Sport NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$100 per workshop§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§ § §Drug Free Sport New Zealand (DFSNZ) is New Zealand's national anti-doping organisation committed to protecting and promoting a culture of clean, drug free sport.  In conjunction with a comprehensive Testing and Investigations programme, DFSNZ is responsible for education and promotion of clean sport.  § § §About the role§ § §We have an exciting opportunity in Auckland for a new Educator to join the DFSNZ education team.  As an external contractor to DFSNZ, you will facilitate workshops and webinars to elite-level, national and development athletes and their support personnel.  You will also facilitate values-based workshops in secondary schools.  You will facilitate content provided by DFSNZ and work on as-required basis.  On occasion, you may also be asked to facilitate Outreach Programmes at various sports events. It will be preferred if the successful candidate can occasionally travel overnight to deliver workshops regionally.§ §As a contractor, you will be paid per workshop.  On average, you will deliver 25 workshops per year.  § § §Benefits and perks§ § §This role provides the opportunity to educate athletes and support personnel and gain a unique insight into various sporting environments. § §As a contractor, this role provides the freedom to incorporate this work around other commitments you may have.  § § §Skills and experience§ § §We are seeking a confident, personable individual who is passionate about clean sport.  The ideal candidate will be a current or former athlete who has experience in delivering workshops.   You will need to have confidence to present to large audiences and the ability to engage with a wide range of athletes across a variety of settings.  You must have flexibility to be We have plans in place to take the strong foundations of our past and build an unbeatable platform for the future. §That is where you come in.   As Club Operations & Development Manager, this is the job you have been waiting for.§Crazy about the game, you know what it takes and will be responsible for ensuring and assisting the Club Board to deliver the strategic objectives of the club and facilitate the day to day running of the club. Working with Auckland Rugby and the Club, the Club Operations Manager is responsible for generating new revenue opportunities through a robust financial management strategy. Using the availability of grant and trust funding to ensure the club is financially sustainable. Additionally, working to creating new and exciting sponsorship opportunities to further assist the club financially.§You will be responsible for the implementation of the rugby participation growth strategy for the Club. Focused on attracting, retaining, and developing players, coaches, managers, and volunteers and working with the local schools to create a positive relationship between the club and these connected communities. This will be achieved through collaborating with Auckland Rugby, Club members and the local school networks to promoting benefits to rugby participation.§You're like Richie - hardworking, humble, a reluctant hero, and the face of the team without hogging the limelight. You are known as a good sport, the guy that sets the standard, and the one who'll kick you into shape if you let the team down.§You take pride in your No 8 wire mentality and you run a professional ship. The sides at Eden Rugby Club reflect a strong multi-cultural grouping of Europeans, Maoris, Polynesians, and Asians all proud to be associated with the club. Although this generation of players may support the 'blue and white' hoops of Auckland, the 'sky blue' of the Blues and the 'almighty black' of the All Blacks, they all proudly wear the gold and black hoops of the Eden Rugby Club. Take the plunge and become a Summer Pool Lifeguard! Full training and support provided in a large organisation with options for career development and progression.§ § § §This role is for the summer period only, starting mid-November or December 2020 until the end of March 2021.  Hours of work will vary week to week depending on the roster.  We are open 7 days from 5.30am to 9.30pm Monday to Friday and 7am to 7pm in the weekend.  §Applicants MUST be available to work over the Christmas and New Year period.§ § § §We are looking for lifeguards to work at our centres based in Onehunga and Panmure.  § § § §YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §A typical day in the life of our Lifeguards will include supervising pool users ensuring a safe and fun environment for all and rotating around different stations and pools – all while interacting and building relationships with our customers.§ § § §What will you need?§ § §Confidence in swimming – there will be a swim test involved§ §Enthusiasm and responsibility§ §Ability to work effectively across all cultures and ages§ §Strong communication and high work standards§ §Great work ethics and a team player attitude§ §Effective problem solving and ability to think and act fast§ §Experience in a customer service role or similar preferable  § § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Full training – you will gain a PLPC (Pool Lifeguard Practising Certificate)§ §Ongoing training and professional development provided§ §Opportunity to build your career within the YMCA§ §Full gym membership across multiple locations§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 800 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.  We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by using the Apply Now button to submit your cover letter and CV.  Please state on your cover letter if you would prefer to work at Panmure or Onehunga or across both.§ § § §Alternatively applications for Panmure can be sent to §tepuea.li@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ and application for Onehunga can be sent to §roberto.matimtim@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Royal Life Saving Pool Lifeguard certificate?§Are you available to work public holidays?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§

jobText: TXT/50741390.txt	§Seasonal  Fixed Term Lifeguards §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal  Fixed Term Lifeguards §§Advertiser: §Horowhenua District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Pool Lifeguard – Fixed Term. §Join our amazing Team of Lifeguards!§Aquatics Horowhenua opened its doors in 1990 and since then it has been continuously growing and expanding. We offer a variety of activities such as learn to swim, aquacise, fitness training, swim and water sports clubs as well as recreational water fun including inflatables and the hydro slide. It’s easy to understand why our facilities are so popular!§About us.§We are located at the heart of the Horowhenua District, featuring a stunning natural environment on the lower west coast of the North Island, where the mountains meet the sea. Kilometres of unspoilt beaches, forest walks and a hinterland that is rich in both Maori and European history. Horowhenua is blessed with superb natural assets, treasured historical heritage and a thriving cultural life, all within easy reach of New Zealand's capital city Wellington, which is just over an hour drive to the south.§Horowhenua can offer all essential services and sophisticated facilities and at the same time also provides a wealth of quintessential New Zealand experiences from the simple pleasures of a walk along a pristine beach to experiencing life in classic, Kiwi small towns. With about 30,000 residents living between the Tararua Ranges and the Tasman Sea, Horowhenua is the perfect place to live, work and play.§About the role§.§We have a number of fixed-term roles available across Levin, Shannon and Foxton with varying hours. You would join a dynamic team of professionals who deliver excellent public service to our community through ensuring enjoyment and active supervision by identifying risks, hazards, and the prevention of accidents. You would interact with a variety of people from different ages and backgrounds which will enrich your skills and cultural experience.§We are open 7 days a week, including public holidays, and our roster offers shifts between the hours of 5:30am and 9:30pm, at our local centres in Levin, Foxton, and Shannon.§About you.§Our ideal candidates will share a passion for service delivery and customer satisfaction, with a strong positive attitude. As one of the requirements to become a Lifeguard, applicants would need to be confident in the water and be able to swim 200 metres in under 6 minutes.§If this sounds like the ideal place and role for you, we would like to hear from you. For any questions or additional information, please contact us on §06 368 0070§.§Shortlisted applicants will be invited for a swim test and job suitability assessment prior to an interview. Preferred applicants will need to undergo the usual pre-employment checks including drug and criminal history checks. Successful applicants will be required to attend a full week of training.§Applications close: 30th October 2020 at 5pm. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD---Aquatics-Poolside-Lifeguard---April-2020-CURRENT.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50756853.txt	§Summer Staff§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Summer Staff§§Advertiser: §Community Leisure Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§About§ §The Lido Aquatic Centre is seeking a part time Customer Service, lifeguards and Swim Instructors to join their team.  The Lido Aquatic Centre includes both indoor and outdoor pools, hydroslides, and is also home to New Zealand’s largest and fastest growing swim school; SwimMagic. § §Customer Service Positions§ §The position includes working on our front desk dealing with enquiries, facility bookings, cash handling and other administration tasks.  Previous customer service, sales and administration experience is essential.  You need to enjoy working with a team, be friendly, enthusiastic, honest and reliable.  You must be able to work unsupervised, be organised, computer savvy and have a passion for health and fitness and sport and recreation.§ §Lifeguard § §Ideally you will hold relevant lifeguarding qualifications however on-site training can be provided for those wanting to enter this exciting industry. Experience working in an aquatic environment and the ability to follow systems and procedures would be advantageous. You need to enjoy working with a team, be friendly, enthusiastic, honest and reliable. You must be able to work unsupervised, be organised, computer savvy and have a passion for health and fitness and sport and recreation.§ §Swim Instructors§ §You must have a passion for swimming and be comfortable working with children of all ages and all abilities. Experience and relevant swim teaching qualifications are preferred however training and support can be offered to the right candidates. You need to enjoy working within a team in a professional manner and within a structured system. You will be dependable, honest, organised and have excellent communication skills.§ §Hours§ §The roles are part time and are based around the opening hours of the facility, and therefore the role may require you to work early morning, late shifts and weekend work.  Flexibility is key to ensure that the facilities are being run to highest possible standard.§ §Benefits § §Ongoing training and development and free use of facilities available.§ §Relevant qualifications in this area would be advantageous, however training can be provided for the role. § §How to apply§ §If you are a team player and enjoy an exciting work environment please apply in writing with a current CV and a covering letter §indicating which role you are applying for§ to Alisha Patel on §alp@clmnz.co.nz§ §Application period closes Sunday 25th October 2020§§§§

The SOON TO BE §Snap Fitness Whangarei§ is looking for a Superstar Club Manager with a passion for Health and Fitness, a drive for success and a willingness to learn, to JOIN OUR TEAM. § §The Role:§As the Club Manager you will be responsible for the day to day tasks such as achieving lead generation, sales targets, member retention, marketing, hiring and management of Personal Trainers, customer service, building a community-based culture within the club and local community during the pre-sale and once open.§ §To stand out, you will need to have: § § §A proven track record of setting, achieving and surpassing LEAD GENERATION and SALES Targets§ §Strong sales and marketing experience§ §Proven success in outreach and community engagement (highly regarded)§ §The ability to forward think and plan for success§ §Outstanding customer service and people skills§ §Excellent leadership skills§ §An eye for detail and strong administration skills§ §Be a team player and be WILLING to learn and grow with the club§ §PRE-SALES Experience within the Health and Fitness industry will be a bonus§ §First Aid/CPR Certificate (or willing to undertake)§ §To Apply§ §If you are Passionate, Excited and READY to take the next step in your career, submit your application (CV + Cover Letter) now!§ § § § §Please note due to high volume of applicants, Only those that are successful to move onto the next round will be contacted.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Do you have lead generation experience?§§§

Your main responsibilities will include:§        § §        §          §Providing guidance on and supporting the delivery of aquatics based programmes;§          §General lifeguarding duties to ensures customers are safe and looked after; and§          §Supporting the Team Leader with day to day operations at the Centre.§        §        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §It goes without saying that you’ll have a passion for aquatics, and you’ll enjoy sharing your knowledge and experience with customers and colleagues to improve water safety. You will be an excellent communicator, and committed to delivering exceptional aquatic programmes and providing a high level of customer satisfaction.  Joining an energetic and passionate team, you’ll be a keen team player with a flexible approach, and be able to take initiative to help drive a positive safety culture.§        § §        §You’ll need to hold a current First Aid Certificate as well as a Pool Lifeguard Practising Certificate. As the centre operates 7 days a week, reliability and commitment to working early, late and weekend shifts are crucial.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §You’ll have access to a range of fantastic Auckland Council benefits, including an annual zoo pass and a range of partnership discounts. And as you will be a Leisure Centre employee, you will enjoy free use of the facilities. To find out more about Otara Pool and Leisure, please visit our §website§.§        § §        §You will be working 40 hours per week, rostered 5 days a week and will include weekends, early start and late finish. §        § §        §Our Centres play a fundamental role in our goal to "Get Active Your Way". If you are passionate about fitness, wellbeing and aquatic safety, then come help us make this goal a reality!§        § §        §Applications close on 28 October 2020. §        § §        §This position is deemed a safety sensitive position and will require pre-employment drug testing.This position is deemed a safety sensitive position and will require pre-employment drug testing.§        § §        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. jobText: TXT/50791186.txt	§Basketball Referee/Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Basketball Referee/Coach§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §YMCA is looking for an experienced Basketball Referee to join the team at North Shore.Your role will be to officiate at sporting events, games, or competitions, to maintain standards of play and to ensure that game rules and regulations are observed.Teach and explain the rules, regulations, and etiquette governing a specific sport.§ § § §What will you be doing?§ § §Referee/umpire games or competitions in a professional manner§ §Ensure games are refereed/umpired in accordance with industry standards§ §Use appropriate signals to communicate decisions to participants and any other officiating colleagues§ §Ensure the correct use of equipment at all times§ §Ensure all games start and finish on time§ § § §What experience/skills do you need?§ § §Sound knowledge of the sport being refereed / umpired§ §Experience in sport officiating§ §Excellent communication and organisational skills§ §Current First Aid Certificate§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Free YMCA Multi-site gym membership for you§ §Free Parking§ §Discounts to various other YMCA services§ §Career progression within a well-reputed and respected organisation§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §mahalia.rolston@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§§§

jobText: TXT/50782815.txt	§Learn To Swim Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Learn To Swim Instructor§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Learn To Swim Instructor §      §        §          §Fun and flexible team environment§          §Free use of facilities§          §Located at West Wave§        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Here at Auckland Council, our leisure centres play a key role in achieving our goal of getting more Aucklanders, more active, more often. And right now, we’re looking for a Learn to Swim Instructor at West Wave Pool and Leisure Centre to help achieve that goal!§        § §        §This is a part-time position working during the school term. As you will be working on a 7-day rotating roster, having the flexibility to work afternoons, evenings and weekends are going to be key to your success in this role.§        § §        §This is a fantastic job where you don’t need any formal qualifications or experience – just a passion to work with our diverse community and make a difference!§        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §If you do have a recognised swim teacher qualification or previous experience as a swimming instructor, that’s great – but if you don’t that’s fine too as we’ll provide all of the training you need to do the job! You’ll need to complete your first aid certificate, have a love of water, a commitment to exceptional customer service, and an ability to communicate well with adults and children.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §As a Learn to Swim Instructor, you’ll enjoy free use facilities, flexible working hours that fit in with your life, and a fun working environment. And to top it off, you’ll have the satisfaction of knowing the work you do is important, and you’ll enjoy the satisfaction of watching someone gain the confidence that comes from learning how to swim.§        § §        §To find out more about West Wave Pool and Leisure Centre, please visit our §website§.§        § §        §Applications close 26th October 2020 §        § §        § §        §This position is deemed a safety-sensitive position and will require pre-employment drug testing.§        § §        §Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the §Vulnerable Children Act 2014§. As such applicants will be required to undergo §police vetting§ prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §To find out more and apply visit§      §careers.aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§    §  §§§ §Fun and flexible team environment§ §Free use of facilities§ §Located at West Wave§ § §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Here at Auckland Council, our leisure centres play a key role in achieving our goal of getting more Aucklanders, more active, more often. And right now, we’re looking for a Learn to Swim Instructor at West Wave Pool and Leisure Centre to help achieve that goal!§ §This is a part-time position working during the school term. As you will be working on a 7-day rotating roster, having the flexibility to work afternoons, evenings and weekends are going to be key to your success in this role.§ §This is a fantastic job where you don’t need any formal qualifications or experience – just a passion to work with our diverse community and make a difference!§ §He kōrero mōu: About you§ §If you do have a recognised swim teacher qualification or previous experience as a swimming instructor, that’s great – but if you don’t that’s fine too as we’ll provide all of the training you need to do the job! You’ll need to complete your first aid certificate, have a love of water, a commitment to exceptional customer service, and an ability to communicate well with adults and children.§ §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§ §As a Learn to Swim Instructor, you’ll enjoy free use facilities, flexible working hours that fit in with your life, and a fun working environment. And to top it off, you’ll have the satisfaction of knowing the work you do is important, and you’ll enjoy the satisfaction of watching someone gain the confidence that comes from learning how to swim.§ §To find out more about West Wave Pool and Leisure Centre, please visit our §website§.§ §Applications close 26th October 2020 § § §This position is deemed a safety-sensitive position and will require pre-employment drug testing.§ §Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the §Vulnerable Children Act 2014§. As such applicants will be required to undergo §police vetting§ prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50785172.txt	§Swim School Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim School Instructor§§Advertiser: §Community Leisure Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About§ §CLM The Bays is a premium Health and Fitness Facility, that includes a specialist Swim School. Based in the Eastern Suburbs of Auckland, we are currently on the lookout for Swim Instructors.§ §SwimMagic is the largest swim school provider in New Zealand and is founded on a unique graduated structure, focusing on achievable goals and incentives to ensure that children are progressing as efficiently as possible.§ §The Role§ §Our current vacancies are for Swim Instructors that have the ability to teach all levels from babies through to adults. As well as the potential to assist us in our Schools programme instructing swimming and water safety.§ §We provide on the job training and up skilling through constant feedback, and the opportunity to be mentored by some of the best in the biz. If you thrive in a fun, engaging environment then this could be the job for you.§ §Our lessons run Monday to Sunday and you will be assigned classes to make your own. A year round model means that our swim lessons are over 48 weeks.§ §Skills§ §We are looking for several new Swim Instructors so if you tick a few boxes in the below requirements don’t hesitate, send us your CV!§ §- Confidence in the water.§ §- Comfortable with kids.§ §- Amazing Customer Service skills to interact with both students and parents.§ §- Prior swim teaching and qualifications are preferable.§ §Benefits§ §Your package includes competitive remuneration, ongoing training and development, free car parking and a complimentary gym membership to make the most of our facility.§ §Applicants must hold a valid working visa to be considered for the role.§ §How to apply§ §If you have the required skills and would like to join our amazing team, please send your CV with covering letter to Alisha at §alisha.patel@clmnz.co.nz§  by Friday 20th November 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50800960.txt	§Fitness Trainer and Receptionist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Fitness Trainer and Receptionist§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Fitness & Personal Training§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §We are looking for an energetic Fitness Trainer who can also work as a Receptionist to join our Fitness Team based in Central Auckland.§ § § §You would work as a Fitness Trainer on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday from 5:15am to 11:15am. On Saturday and Sunday you would be based at reception from 7.45am to 4pm. Both roles complement each other well.§ § § §The purpose of the Reception role is to provide a high standard customer service to our members. Sales and Retention form a crucial part of this role and tasks such as completing sales and renewal processes, member communication and lead management are part of this role.§ § § §What will you be doing as a Fitness Trainer?§ § §Helping to on-board individuals that have shown interest in our facility§ §Deliver Small Group Training sessions§ §Prescribe and demonstrate exercise§ §Generate a vibrant and inclusive environment§ §Proactively engage with members on the gym floor§ §Ensure healthy and safe practices are followed§ §Dealing with customers, including customer complaints§ § § §What will you be doing as a Receptionist?§ § §General Administration§ §Stadium bookings§ §Loading Fitness Memberships§ §Following up on payments§ §Processing payments, cashing up, checking float variances and daily banking§ §Promote services YMCA has to offer and upselling memberships§ §Maintaining stock§ § § §What experience/skills do you need? § § §Has Small group trainer and/or Group Exercise experience§ §Has fitness trainer experience§ §Is REPs Registered (or able to be)§ §Holds a Fitness qualification (or currently studying)§ §High degree of computer literacy, including intermediate to advanced working knowledge of Microsoft based programmes§ §Customer Service experience and strong administration skills – min 6 months§ §Ability to up-sell and cross sell products and services§ §Excellent communication skills§ § § §X-Factors we are looking for:§ § §Fitness industry qualification and experience§ §Customer service skills and experience§ §Sales experience§ §Ability to multitask§ §Commitment to shifts and flexibility to cover if needed§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Increase knowledge within the Recreation industry§ §Learn new skills to compliment current skills§ §Personal Training§ §Free YMCA Multi-site gym membership for you§ §Free Parking§ §Discounts to various other YMCA services§ §Career progression within a well-reputed and respected organisation§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 165 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a fun and friendly team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §terry.r@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§

jobText: TXT/50805938.txt	§Business Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Manager§§Advertiser: §Tennis Otago Incorporated§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§Vacancy:  Business Manager – Tennis Otago§ §Tennis Otago is looking for a person to fill the position of Business Manager.  The position is initially a contracted position for 30 hours per week, but has great potential for the right person to quickly evolve it into a permanent full-time position.    § §The successful person will be self-motivated, well organised, and show initiative within the role.  A vital part of the role will be experience in preparing funding applications, developing and maintaining effective sponsorship partnerships, and also skills in communications such as Facebook, websites, and e-newsletters. As well as this, the position will require overseeing inter-club tennis and other elements of competition, and various other administration and business support functions.§ §This position is based in Dunedin at the Tennis Otago headquarters at Logan Park Tennis Centre.  Tennis Otago is an Incorporated Society supporting the region’s tennis playing members. § §Applications close 5pm November 16th, 2020.§Please e-mail a brief application letter with your CV to Tennis Otago at john@bnol.co.nz [link removed] and we can forward you a copy of the Job Description. § §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid work visa.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a business manager?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

Our Membership Consultant is required to seek and sell new membership to prospects and assist existing members with their membership enquiries. in a TEAM environment§ § § §Work with the Operations Manager/ Head Trainer to ensure that all aspects of the business are operating at the highest level.§ § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § § § §Free access to the studio for your own training§ § § §Ongoing training opportunities§ § § §Training in the F45 product and technology§ § § §Opportunity to work with an innovative fitness system with §Skills and experience§ § § § § §Cert III & IV Fitness (absolute minimum: group fitness)§ § § §Current First Aid Certification§ § § §Outstanding time management and organisational skills§ § § §Proven Team player§ § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§§§

jobText: TXT/50794392.txt	§Lifeguard§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lifeguard§§Advertiser: §Upper Hutt City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Permanent | Full time § §H20 Xtream is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated individual to join the team at one of the region’s most exciting aquatic facilities.§ §As a Lifeguard you will be expected to maintain poolside duties while creating a warm and welcoming atmosphere for our visitors.  You will also contribute to maintaining a quality facility and assist with the operation of pool plant systems.§ §To be successful in this role you must:§ § §Be physically fit with the ability to stand and/or walk for extended periods of time;§ §Have great people skills;§ §Be motivated and professional;§ §Hold a current lifeguard qualification (preferable but not essential.  Training may be provided to gain the appropriate qualifications);§ §Be available to work all shifts of the 3 week rotating roster which includes weekdays, weekends, day and late shifts between the hours of 5.00am – 10.30pm.§ §In return you will be part of a busy, unique aquatic environment that provides quality in-house training opportunities and is a great place to work.§ §We’re a vibrant team who love to have fun on the job, and there are plenty of opportunities for someone like you.§ §If you would like to be considered for this role then please apply online: www.upperhuttcity.com/careers. § §All applications must include a cover letter, CV and a completed online Upper Hutt City Council application form.§Applicants must be prepared to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening if short-listed.§ §Applications close 5 November 2020 at 9am§NOTE THAT YOU MUST HAVE THE RIGHT TO WORK IN NEW ZEALAND TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE.§§§§

jobTitle: Swim Teacher/Mobile Pool Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50800316.txt	§Swim Teacher/Mobile Pool Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swim Teacher/Mobile Pool Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Awesome Trading Solutions Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§Up to $25.00 per hour + car + quarterly bonus§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Join our team and become an ‘Awesome’ Swim Teacher/Mobile Pool Coordinator.§If you’re based in South Auckland/Franklin and enjoy working with preschoolers, love the water, have a passion for teaching and are mechanically-minded, then this might just be the role you’ve been looking for.   §Who are we?§Since 2014, Captain Awesome’s Mobile Swim Schools has been offering a unique approach to swimming lessons. We  take our mobile, heated, indoor pool to our client’s preschool and deliver lessons to the children while in the preschool’s care, removing the need for parents to take their children to lessons and freeing-up weekend family time.  These lessons operate Monday to Friday  during the school term only.§In 2018, we launched our Summer Swim Schools programme which runs during the summer months, January - March, and offers swim lessons to all ages, either in our mobile pool or at another location; usually a local school pool.  This year we launched our Wellness Warriors programme which provides lessons aimed at developing and enhancing student’s overall wellbeing, whilst teaching them simple and easy-to-use lifelong skills combining mindfulness, meditation and yoga. These lessons are held in the preschool.§What will you be doing?§Commencing in this role 18 January 2021, you’ll be responsible for:§Teaching the life skill of swimming as required using our Lesson Plan, within the South Auckland/Franklin area§Creating a fun, safe environment for participants§Providing outstanding customer service to our students, preschool staff and parents§Health and safety for all persons in or around the mobile pool at all times, including managing chemicals appropriately§Mobile pool coordination and water management, including towing the pool to the preschool, pool set up and pool pack up§Lesson and pool administration and record keeping§Communicating effectively and professionally.§Your working day will start either when you leave home with our pool (depending on your location) or collect our pool, and head directly to your first preschool.  Working from 8am-3pm during the school term, you’ll enjoy having school holidays and weekends off, unless you need to make up a missed lesson from during that term.  You’ll also have the option of additional hours by teaching in our Summer Swim School holiday or after-school programmes wherever possible.§How awesome are you?§Ideally, you will:§Have relevant experience as a swim teacher§Be self-managing and responsible, working effectively independently and unsupervised§Be honest and reliable§Have a full and clean driver’s license§Work well with children; be fun-loving, firm, friendly, creative, vibrant, observant, caring and kind§Have excellent customer service manner, easily building rapport with others§Be adaptable, focussed, proactive and dedicated§Maintain high standards§Solve problems easily and effectively§Be able to complete administration tasks easily using Google Drive, Excel and Outlook§Have an understanding, desire and ability to maintain health and safety protocols§Have the confidence and ability to back and tow a trailer safely. This is preferred but not essential as full training is given.§Have the ability to safely park the mobile pool at your home during the evenings and weekend, preferred but not essential.§You must have a clean criminal record and be able to pass a Children’s Worker Safety Check.§What do we offer?§We value our team and know our success is because they’re awesome.  If you’re awesome, you’ll receive a competitive wage (up to $25.00 per hour), a company car and fuel card, company phone, bonus plan, plus ongoing development and training, and the use of the mobile pool in the evenings, weekends and school holidays if you park this at your home!  §This is totally me! What should I do?§Don’t delay! Send your CV in today to §info@captainawesome.co.nz§ or if you require more information, please contact Kim Ahern on 027 222 8145.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a teacher?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§§§

jobText: TXT/50803022.txt	§Yoga Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Yoga Instructor§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Location:§ Hamilton City§ §Employment Type:§  Permanent§ §Applications Close: §5 November 2020§ § § §About the Opportunity § § §Hamilton Pools is a flagship service for Hamilton City Council, providing swimming, fitness and wellbeing facilities for our growing city’s residents.§ §The team at Hamilton Pools prides itself on helping our customers achieve their health, well-being and fitness goals.§ §Fundamental to this, part of our customer service are our Group Fitness Instructors and we’re currently looking for a committed and motivated Yoga Instructor.§This is a permanent part-time position, however we would also consider a contractor in the position.§ §As the Yoga Instructor you will be working 2 hours per week as scheduled with the possibility of more classes in the future. Our current timetable consists of 4 yoga classes per week so you will be asked to teach extra classes to cover sickness and leave.§ §About You§ §- You’ll have a recognised Yoga or fitness qualification§- Some experience teaching Yoga is preferred but not essential§- Health and Safety knowledge and practice§- Able to work well within a team environment§- Be self-motivated§- Have exceptional customer service skills§- Flexibility to cover classes on the timetable§ §About the Benefits§ §Waterworld is a full-service health and wellness facility offering a wide range of membership options. Members and casual customers can take full advantage of the great range of cardiovascular, resistance and free-weight equipment. We also offer 35+ group fitness classes per week.§You’ll be working in a great location with free car parking, be able to explore career development opportunities, and be joining a dedicated and fun team.§ § §To view the full position description, §click here§ §This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. This role is covered by the Children’s Act 2014, which means that shortlisted candidates will be required to undergo all safety checking requirements under the Act before commencing employment, as well as during employment. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50829730.txt	§Swimgym Swim Teacher§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Swimgym Swim Teacher§§Advertiser: §Swimgym§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§About the business§ § §Swim Well, Swim Fast, Swim Safe, are our brand promises. Community, Diversity, Leadership, Passionate, Performance and Kia Kaha are our Values. § §We are committed to getting to 5,000,000 splashes before 2024 and we have delivered just over 3.4million swim and survive lessons now.§ §We are a swimming club that delivers swimming lessons as well. Starting with little ones and teaching them the soft skills of swimming and then working up to international athletes. Swimmers will learn heaps about themselves and their sport. § §Swimgym operates out of a number of pools in South and East Auckland. We are looking to start to train teachers for the inevitable rush in summer.§ § §About the role§ § §Swim teaching is one of the most rewarding roles imaginable. We take littlies who are scared of the water and teach them peace, we take those who have no fear and give them boundaries. We encourage and develop. We challenge and perform. § §Swimgym will have a number of positions available for swimming lessons through the day in our award winning Find Your Field of Dreams programme. We will also have spaces available for teachers at Pre-School, School age and  Mini Squad levels. If you have an affinity with children, enjoy water sports and teaching then this may be the perfect role for you.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Swimgym is a flexible employer who will work with you to find the appropriate role for you along with hours that suit your schedule. Our environment is the service to sport, and what could be more fun than that. Teaching young swimmers, seeing progress and achieving goals are the things that drive our current staff and you could be a part of that. § §We have a great group of teachers who you will work alongside (should you be successful in your application). This is more than just a job.§ §Swimgym offers an opportunity to work with swimmers from 3 months old through to our schools programme, swimmers with special abilities, seniors and international athletes. § § §Skills and experience§ § §Swim Teachers need to be empathetic to the needs of the swimmers infront of them. Being a skilled teachers is knowing where the swimmer is now and encouraging them to get further along the swimming continuum. Experienced teachers are welcome, and we are well set up to train you to become an experienced teacher. Dive into the power of water with us. § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§§§

(Experience dependant)§ § § § § §Do you have a passion for COMMUNITY SPORT! § §We have some big shoes to fill as our current Regional Development Manager is off on a new adventure, so we are looking for a dynamic, energetic individual to fill the role. If you are keen to get fully immersed in community sport and be a key contributor to the Associations purpose of “providing a great sport for life” we are looking for you!§ § § §Your role will be responsible with increasing participation, providing outstanding delivery of hockey at a school and club level, organising the local competitions and tournaments, and enhancing the experiences of all our current members.  You will also be a key in connecting our club and school communities.§ § § §Ideally, you’ll be experienced in sport development whether this is within hockey or sitting with another sports code. You must be able to show versatility and confidence.  Having experience in dealing with volunteers of different ages would be a bonus too.§ § § § § §About Us: § §The Association governs hockey in the Nelson Region, providing social and competitive hockey opportunities to our membership and clubs, and development opportunities to schools.§ § § §With around 1000 members we must ensure we remain relevant to our community and provide a service that caters for young kids all the way through to our most senior volunteers and players.§ § § §Boasting 2 international standard turfs, we attract both national and international tournaments.§ § § §Relevant Skills and Experience§ § §Motivated self-starter possessing confidence and professionalism§ §Highly developed leadership and interpersonal skills§ §Ability and willingness to take on daily administrative tasks§ §Experience with hosting and organising competitions and tournaments§ §Experience in the delivery of coach, volunteer and player development initiatives§ §Experience in delivering sport within schools§ §Cultural awareness and sensitivity, community minded§ § § § § §For a full role description or further information please contact § §manager@nelsonhockey.org.nz§                 § §Applications close: Wednesday 25th November§ §Interviews will be held the week beginning 30th of November in Nelson.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§Do you own or have regular access to a car?§§§

Our high profile services are delivered through the Regions 17 Surf Lifesaving Clubs, volunteers and paid staff in the areas of beach safety, education and sporting activities.§  § §  §Preventing injury and drowning through the provision of a regional 'integrated Lifeguard service' provided by volunteer and paid Lifeguards, underpinned by a Regional Support Service team, is at the heart of what we do. SLSNR is seeking a §6 month fixed term§ Patrol Operations Supervisor with immediate start (with the possibility to turn permanent) who will support our lifesaving team to deliver this valuable service. The successful applicate will need to be flexible and be able to work weekends. §  §The patrol operations supervisor will be based in Auckland and will require regular travel. jobText: TXT/50826022.txt	§Specialist Outdoor Instructor - Education outside the Classroom (EOTC)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Specialist Outdoor Instructor - Education outside the Classroom (EOTC)§§Advertiser: §King's College§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§An exciting opportunity has arisen for a capable and experienced Outdoor Education Specialist to join the friendly team at the King's College Venture Camp in a senior level instructor role.§ §It is a Challenging, busy and varied role.§ § §Work with a committed team of professionals in a friendly environment.§ § §Contribute positively in the facilitation of learning and growth within the outdoor education experience for Y10 students.§ § §King’s College is a provider of a premium month-long Adventure Challenge for Year 10 students, with a vacancy for an Assistant Specialist to not only oversee and ensure the smooth, safe and efficient running of the experience, but vitally to provide and maintain the King’s College ethos, standards and objectives for the courses.§ §The successful candidate will be passionate about facilitating trans-formative outdoor experiences for secondary school students.§ §The role has the King’s College Venture Camp in Ahuroa as its initial base for the year 10 Challenge. From here the students’ journey moves to sailing on the Hauraki Gulf and finally moving down to the Central North Island.§ §The position would be involved in all areas of the course.§ §The successful candidate would be responsible for leading, supervising, supporting and providing both technical and logistical assistance to both qualified and more junior staff from outdoor providers who deliver the outdoor experiences to our students.§ §Activities undertaken during our adventure courses include, multi day tramping, both on and off track, rock climbing, high ropes activities, alpine mountain experiences, shooting, caving, mountain biking, sailing, canyoning and coasteering.§ §This is a residential experience for the students so the candidate will be required to spend up to 7 days at a time away from home.§ §The role also involves the upkeep and maintenance of equipment and facilities involved in the running of the Ahuroa facility.§ §In addition to the Year 10 Adventure Challenge, the Specialist Outdoor Instructor EOTC will help to facilitate other outdoor education offerings as part of the wider Physical Education curriculum.§ § §The successful candidate will need NZOIA qualifications or equivalent experience in a number of relevant outdoor activities. King’s College will provide ongoing training and PD for the upkeep and development of the successful candidate’s qualifications.§ §A minimum of 4 years’ experience working in the outdoors, hopefully with some evidence of working in a supervisory senior role.§ §The position will be well remunerated, commensurate with the successful applicant's qualifications, skills and experience.  § §Apply now. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

All Lifeguards are required to have the capability to work at any facility across the network's 5 aquatic sites, so flexibility is essential.§  §You will have the opportunity to build great relationships with staff and customers, along with providing people from Tauranga, New Zealand and all over the world with the best possible customer experience while staying in ‘The Bay'. § § §Has experience in referring, programme management, leadership, marketing and promoting sports leagues§ §Knowledge of the sports, recreation and fitness industry desirable but not essential§ §Proven ability to build relationships§ §Excellent communication skills§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 165 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §nela.teaurima@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§

This is underpinned by our community sport strategy: §The Auckland Approach to Community Sport§ – a vision for co-creating a world-class sport system in Auckland.§  §To support this work, an exciting opportunity has arisen.§  §About the role: §  §This role will lead the development of monitoring and evaluation tools and resources and provide capability development support to Aktive, our community delivery partners (CLM - Community Sport, College Sport Auckland, Harbour Sport, Sport Auckland and Sport Waitākere) and the wider sector to help us better demonstrate the impact of our work.§  §This role reports to the Insights Manager and works closely with the General Manager Community Sport, to ensure a consolidated insights and evaluation approach across our community sport strategy:§ The Auckland Approach to Community Sport§.§  §You will bring significant analytical, communication and reporting skills to the role and will enjoy the challenges and opportunities of developing and providing tools, resources and support to boost monitoring and evaluation efforts.§  §Further information§  §To view our detailed position descriptions please copy and paste the below link in your web browser.  https://aktive.org.nz/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Senior-Advisor-Monitoring-Evaluation-JD.pdf§  §How to apply§  §To be considered please apply with a CV and covering letter via SEEK. §  §Applications close on Monday 23 November 2020 at 5pm§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have a current Working With Children (WWC) Check?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§
