jobText: TXT/50844927.txt	§Multi-Site Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Multi-Site Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §YMCA of Auckland Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §We are in need of an experienced Centre Manager to join the team across Hamilton and Tauranga.  The role is predominantly based in Hamilton, but does require weekly travel to Tauranga.  § § § §The purpose of the role is to lead, manage and develop the business of multi centres to achieve YMCA advancement, internal and external collaboration, operational excellence and financial success. The role will require staff management, financial management, business planning, marketing, risk management, programme and service development and effective evaluation and reporting.§ § § §What will you be doing?§ § §Deliver Business Unit objectives within the centre§ §Deliver financial targets and effective budgeting§ §Produce high quality reports on time§ §Develop and maintain strong staff structure and staff management frameworks§ §Actively promote and drive YMCA values and strategic direction§ §Deliver successful community engagement and consultation§ §Optimise programme structures, delivery frameworks and quality§ § § §What experience/skills do you need? § § §Minimum 5 years’ experience in a management role§ §Previous experience working in Fitness and Recreation§ §Has relevant qualifications in management, fitness or recreation is desirable§ §Experience with budgeting, business planning and/or financial analysis§ §Has strong leadership skills including the ability to coach, manage and train staff§ §Excellent communication skills at all levels§ §Current Full New Zealand license is essential§ § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Specific job and safeguarding training with opportunities for continuous improvement.§ §A great team, organisational culture§ §Career opportunities§ §YMCA buying privileges and discounts§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 700 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 165 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.§ §We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by sending your CV and cover letter to §jackie.marshall@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a centre manager?§How many years' experience do you have with forecasting for businesses?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50864945.txt	§Customer Service, Sales, Deliveries, Installations & Service Technician work§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service, Sales, Deliveries, Installations & Service Technician work§§Advertiser: §KINGS RECRUITMENT LTD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§Salary + Commission + use of car§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Customer Service, Sales, Deliveries, Installations & Service Technician work §    §      §        §          §WORLD No.1 Selling brand for this premium product – Business is BOOMING!§          §Seeking all-rounder for mix of Deliveries, Installations, Customer Service & Showroom Sales§          §Must be physically fit, technically savvy and have good Customer Service skills§        §        §Our client represents the most well recognized high end, premium Spa brand. For over thirty years, they have sold this premium spa brand directly to the consumer, via a national chain of showrooms, which now has grown to 24 branches in NZ and Australia. They pride themselves on being the best in the business!§        §On their behalf we are to appoint a capable, customer focused person to take on a hybrid role, which will be a mixture of Customer Deliveries and Installations, some onsite Technical Support§ and some Customer service and Showroom Sales.§        §This is a Monday to Friday role, with some occasional hours on a weekend and will be based out of their Lower Hutt Showroom.§        §How the role will work?§        §1 day a week: §You will be responsible for the Spa delivery & installation service to customers who have purchased a Spa. For this part of the role, you will need to be able to drive a manual vehicle and be able to reverse a trailer. (Must have a Full  drivers license). This is the physical part of the role, so you will need to be able use the equipment to support the spa delivery.§        §Delivery of a new spa is a very exciting time for their customers.  So, we need someone who will take the care and time to give a first-class customer service experience.  Not only will you be making the delivery, you will be installing the spa and providing the customer some training on how it runs.  It is really important for this part of the role that you are well-groomed, with exceptional communication and customer service skills.§        §2 days of the week: §You will also be trained up as a Spa Technician and will be responsible for fault finding and repairing spas. You will get full training in this area, but it would make it much easier if you came armed with some practical technical skills and experience. Basic handyman type skills will be good start!§        §For the other 2 days of the week§, you will be based in the Lower Hutt showroom and will be performing a Sales and Customer Service function. Assisting customers in their spa choices and sharing just why their spas are the very best that you can buy.§        §This is a great time to flex your sales skills and you will get paid commissions on any spas you sell (as well as spa chemicals and consumables).§        §Again, you will get in-depth product and sales training to ensure you are confident in this area.§        §This company will give you plenty of training across all the functions of this role. But there are certain skills and attributes that are not so easy to train -   Your Enthusiasm, Your Motivation and your   ability to connect with Customers, so we want you to bring that to the role.§        §Remuneration§: Salary + commission + use of company vehicle §        §So, if you are looking for a busy role with piles of variety and you want to be rewarded well for your hard work, then get in touch today!§        §Apply Via Seek or to §info@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§  §09 600 5152§ / 0800 FORJOBS - Ask for Cherish§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §WORLD No.1 Selling brand for this premium product – Business is BOOMING!§ §Seeking all-rounder for mix of Deliveries, Installations, Customer Service & Showroom Sales§ §Must be physically fit, technically savvy and have good Customer Service skills§ §Our client represents the most well recognized high end, premium Spa brand. For this part of the role, you will need to be able to drive a manual vehicle and be able to reverse a trailer. (Must have a Full  drivers license). This is the physical part of the role, so you will need to be able use the equipment to support the spa delivery.§ §Delivery of a new spa is a very exciting time for their customers.  So, we need someone who will take the care and time to give a first-class customer service experience.  Not only will you be making the delivery, you will be installing the spa and providing the customer some training on how it runs.  It is really important for this part of the role that you are well-groomed, with exceptional communication and customer service skills.§ §2 days of the week: §You will also be trained up as a Spa Technician and will be responsible for fault finding and repairing spas. You will get full training in this area, but it would make it much easier if you came armed with some practical technical skills and experience. Basic handyman type skills will be good start!§ §For the other 2 days of the week§, you will be based in the Lower Hutt showroom and will be performing a Sales and Customer Service function. Assisting customers in their spa choices and sharing just why their spas are the very best that you can buy.§ §This is a great time to flex your sales skills and you will get paid commissions on any spas you sell (as well as spa chemicals and consumables).§ §Again, you will get in-depth product and sales training to ensure you are confident in this area.§ §This company will give you plenty of training across all the functions of this role. But there are certain skills and attributes that are not so easy to train -   Your Enthusiasm, Your Motivation and your   ability to connect with Customers, so we want you to bring that to the role.§ §Remuneration§: Salary + commission + use of company vehicle § §So, if you are looking for a busy role with piles of variety and you want to be rewarded well for your hard work, then get in touch today!§ §Apply Via Seek or to §info@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§  §09 600 5152§ / 0800 FORJOBS - Ask for Cherish§§§§

jobTitle: Chief Executive Officer, International Taekwon-Do Job in Auckland - SEEK
advertiser: Try the SEEK app to find your dream job faster.
experience: International Taekwon-Do (ITKD) is the primary organisation in New Zealand practicing and teaching Taekwon-Do as developed by the art’s Founder, General Choi Hong Hi.  Established over 40 years
jobText: TXT/50844747.txt	§Chief Executive Officer, International Taekwon-Do§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Chief Executive Officer, International Taekwon-Do§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Management§§§§§§International Taekwon-Do (ITKD) is the primary organisation in New Zealand practicing and teaching Taekwon-Do as developed by the art’s Founder, General Choi Hong Hi.  Established over 40 years ago in New Zealand, ITKD comprises of well over 3,500 members belonging to approximately 100 clubs nationwide.  As an organisation, it has been acknowledged by Sport New Zealand as the single largest and best organised martial arts group in the country.§ § § §As a martial art, Taekwon-Do appeals to Kiwis of all ages and backgrounds.  Children can join the specially designed TKD Kubz programme from as young as three, and many members participate well into their 60’s and 70’s.  An art of self-defence, Taekwon-Do is a fantastic way to maintain health, fitness and flexibility.   More than that however, Taekwon-Do also teaches discipline, respect, perseverance, and self-control.§ § § §Affiliated to the art’s global body, International Taekwon-Do Federation, ITKD is recognised around the world for the quality of instruction and their success on the global stage.  All ITKD instructors are certified and all gradings in New Zealand are recognised internationally.  This means that students of ITKD can continue their training at any ITF club anywhere in the world.  New Zealand boasts multiple world champions and in 2015 the New Zealand Team were awarded overall best country at the World Championships. ITKD has further been recognised by the New Zealand Government and is part of Sport New Zealand’s Kiwisport initiative.  Under this initiative, ITKD receives funding to provide Taekwon-Do instruction in a number of Auckland schools.  It has been recognised that Taekwon-Do provides not only health benefits, but is also a fantastic vehicle to improve self-esteem, discipline, and personal accountability.§ § § §ITKD, as an organisation, is governed by a Board of appointed and elected Directors, and is led by the Chief Executive Officer and a small operations team.  There are regional structures and technical advisory groups in place and a large and diverse group of volunteers support the organisation at all levels.§ § § §Reporting to the Board, the Chief Executive will contribute to the short, medium- and long-term strategic planning process.  You will be accountable for the day-to-day running of the organisation, providing leadership to the four person Operations Team, as well as the Regional Directors, Club Instructors, and various external stakeholders including Sport New Zealand, Regional Sports Trusts and the global body.   You will develop, implement, and monitor the annual business plan, managing the annual budgets and overseeing the events and communications schedule.  You will identify innovation, ensuring that ITKD provides the best possible levels of service and support to the Clubs, which will continue to grow the membership and standing of the organisation both nationally and internationally.§ § § §To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate a track record of business leadership and success.  You will be a confident leader, able to not only direct the efforts of the operations team, but also to coral and inspire a cross-section of volunteers.  You will be an adept relationship builder with excellent communication skills, a self-starter with a strong work ethic and the ability to prioritise competing work demands.  You will have confidence managing budgeting, planning and reporting activities and will possess a strong financial analysis skillset.   Experience within a comparable sports or recreation organisation would be highly advantageous, as would exposure working with fundraising, and regional and national sporting bodies.§ § § §Currently, this is a part-time role (circa 20 hours per week), but we would consider applicants seeking a full-time position.§ § § §Applications close at 9am on the 20th November.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50873511.txt	§Recreation Connector - Eastern Bay of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Recreation Connector - Eastern Bay of Plenty§§Advertiser: §Sport Bay Of Plenty§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Part time 0.5 FTE, 20 hours per week – successful candidate can negotiate/determine hours suitable based on community needs.§ §Sport Bay of Plenty is seeking an exceptional Recreation Connector for the Eastern Bay of Plenty region. Reporting to the Active Young People Team Leader, you will be responsible for working closely with recreation providers and schools to enhance the profile of recreation and active recreation opportunities in the region.§ §Working closely across the Eastern Bay of Plenty community the successful candidate will work closely with our stakeholder and partner network to:§ §•Advocate for the benefits of active recreation and influencing key stakeholders.§ §•Understand what active recreation opportunities exist in our communities and the capability of providers§ §•Collecting insights from community members, with a particular focus on rangatahi, and especially girls§ §•Understand the barriers and challenges influencing participation numbers; understanding physical literacy§ §•Embrace a locally led approach with voice of rangatahi as a key consideration§ §•Act as a key connector to address gaps in the system and influence change.§ §Part of the Regional Sports Trust network, Sport Bay of Plenty is a well-established organisation in the Bay of Plenty. This position requires a person who can build and maintain effective working relationships with the ability to lead through empowerment and collaboration.§ § § §You will need to be passionate and committed to the vision of "enriching lives through sport and recreation" and will be a dynamic influencer in the region. Strong experience of recreation at local levels along with relevant qualifications is essential and ideally you will have 5 years' experience in project management.§ § § §A full job description and application form can be obtained from our website www.sportbop.co.nz§ § § §Any queries regarding the position should be made to Nick Chambers, Sport Manager on 027 461 7219 or §nickc@sportbop.co.nz§ § § §Applications for this position close 5.00 pm Wednesday 25th November 2020, with interviews taking place on Friday 4th December 2020.§ § § §The start date for the successful applicant will be from the week beginning 6th January 2021 onwards (negotiable with successful candidate).§§§§

On any given day you might be meeting with community groups, regional or national sports organisations, Ministry of Education, Sport NZ or Regional Sports Trusts.§Experience in the sport and recreation sector or funding area would come with you, along with experience in facility development, programme and/or project management. §Naturally, you'll be a team player with excellent communication skills. This role involves mediating and facilitating conversations, and building strong relationships with our many partners and stakeholders.§Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§This is a great opportunity to join a fun, highly motivated team with a track record of delivery and collaboration. Work on a variety of challenging projects which will keep your work fresh and exciting.§Applications close Monday, 16th November 2020§Auckland Council is committed to the protection and wellbeing of children.  This role is classified as a Children's Worker role under the Vulnerable Children Act 2014. As such applicants will be required to undergo police vetting prior to commencing employment. Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory police check.§Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Located amongst South Canterbury’s amazing natural environment. Apply today, starts Jan 2021.§  § Waihi School is a preparatory day and boarding school located in Winchester, South Canterbury, providing primary education to children from years 4 to 8.  With a proud history, the school has been operating since 1907 and retains the best of traditional values, with a progressive vision for the future.§  § They need a suitably qualified and experienced Outdoor Education Coordinator to join their dedicated team of professionals in 2021 to plan and deliver an exciting outdoor education programme.  This is your chance to leverage your passions and bring your expertise to the role.  As the school hasn’t had a dedicated outdoor education programme in 2020, this will be like a start-up project where you will have the opportunity to design a curriculum around your own strengths, while covering off the school’s core goals and aspirations for the programme, including risk management and decision making, first aid, water skills, outdoor survival and community service.  §  § These are not classroom-based, theory lessons … this is a practical programme where the students are experiencing the natural environment first-hand – and they love it! In fact, if you surveyed the students, Outdoor Education would feature as one of things they love most about Waihi (apart from the great food).§  § We are looking for someone who: § § §Has a recognised qualification in outdoor education§ §Has a proven track record in planning and delivering outdoor education programmes§ §Shows a passion and aptitude for working with young people§ §Demonstrates great planning and risk management skills§ §Has a broad skillset across outdoor activities which may include water sports, rock climbing, hiking, orienteering, mountain biking … the sky is the limit§ §  § In return, you will become part of the famous Waihi family, where interested candidates can become more involved in the life of the school –  this could be through sports coaching, taking boarders on weekend adventures, facilitating participation in excursions such as hiking or mountain biking, or engaging in supervision duties in the boarding house.§  § The school is well resourced, with its own custom-built bike trailer, set of kayaks, wetsuits and, currently under construction is an on-site pump track and low-ropes confidence and team-building course.  Waihi School is situated on 10 acres of beautiful grounds and is a short walk to its namesake the Waihi River where the students enjoy swimming, hut building, campfire building and more.§  § This is a rare opportunity to make your mark and create a curriculum that truly reflects your passions, plus will allow you to engage with a group of enthusiastic participants who value the outdoor education programme.§  § If this is the role you have been looking for, then apply today telling us why we need to meet you, and what you can offer this unique school.§  § Applications close 25 November 2020.§ Enquiries are welcome to Karen Morland on §03 6884805§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following First Aid accreditations do you currently hold?§How many years' experience do you have in the sports & fitness industry?§Do you have experience working with children?§§§

With the school celebrating its 100th year in 2021 and the Centenary in 2022 this makes for an exciting position in the next two years

jobTitle: Aquatics Education Instructor - Part Time  Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50902426.txt	§Aquatics Education Instructor - Part Time §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Aquatics Education Instructor - Part Time §§Advertiser: §Horowhenua District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§ §Aquatics Education Instructor – Permanent Part-Time§Are you passionate about teaching and enjoy working in an active and fun team? Then we want to hear from you! We are currently recruiting for a permanent Part-time Aquatics Education Instructor to help support and cover the constantly growing Streamline Swim School in the Horowhenua.§Swimming is a crucial lifesaving skill and we pride ourselves on delivering the highest standard of swimming and water safety lessons. We offer lessons from 6 month old babies to adults and everyone in between. This includes working with local schools and sports clubs to help support the growth of swimming and water sports in the district.§We are currently looking for one permanent part-time Aquatics Education Instructor with a minimum of 6 hours per week to join the team at Streamline Swim School to help support with covering classes and supporting the schools learn to swim classes. Reporting to the Aquatics Education Coordinator, you will be working on an ad hoc basis to deliver water safety and swimming lessons to a variety of different ages and abilities.§Experience in the industry is always a plus, but as long as you have passion and the desire to learn, full training and qualifications will be provided on the job. All staff will go through basic first aid training and as they progress, will have the opportunity to complete various AUSTSWIM industry qualifications that are recognised globally.§Working hours for the swim school are normally after school and on Saturdays with some work during the week with schools swimming during the term. Sessions normally run from 3pm – 6.30pm Monday to Friday and from 8.30am – 1pm Saturday.§Sound like the position for you or just want to know more? Apply now or contact Megan Ford on §06 368 0070§ for more information!§Applications close Monday 30th November 2020 at 5pm §For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD---Aquatics-Education-Instructor.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§
